input: Janet has ducks that lay 16 eggs every day. She consumes three eggs for breakfast and uses four eggs to bake muffins for her friends. The remaining eggs are sold at the farmers' market for $2 per egg. What is the total amount of money she earns every day by selling the remaining eggs at the farmers' market?
How many bolts of fiber are required to make a robe that needs 2 bolts of blue fiber and half the amount of white fiber needed for the blue fiber?
Josh purchased a house for $80,000 and spent $50,000 on repairs. As a result, the value of the house increased by 150%. What is the profit that Josh made?
If James runs 3 sprints, each of 60 meters, three times a week, what is the total distance he covers in a week?

Wendi has 20 chickens and feeds them three cups of mixed chicken feed, consisting of seeds, mealworms, and vegetables, in three separate meals every day. In the morning, she feeds them 15 cups of feed, and in the afternoon, she feeds them 25 cups of feed. What is the total amount of feed in cups that Wendi needs to give her chickens in the final meal of the day?

Kylar needs to buy 16 glasses for his new apartment from the store. The price of one glass is $5, but the second glass costs only 60% of the original price. Kylar wants to know the total amount he needs to pay for all 16 glasses.

If Seattle has 20 sheep, Charleston has 4 times as many sheep as Seattle, and Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston, what is the total number of sheep that Toulouse, Charleston, and Seattle have together?

Carla is downloading a 200 GB file at a speed of 2 GB/minute. However, when she is 40% through the download, Windows forces a restart to install updates, which takes 20 minutes. After the restart, Carla has to start the download from the beginning. What is the total time it takes for Carla to download the file?

John drove for 3 hours at a speed of 60 mph before realizing he forgot something important at home. He then turned around and tried to get home in 4 hours. However, he encountered 2 hours of standstill traffic and only managed to drive at a speed of 30 mph for the next half-hour. He was able to drive the remaining time of the 4 hours at a speed of 80 mph. What is the distance between John and his home at the end of the 4 hours?

What is the total amount of money Eliza earned this week if her regular hourly rate is $10 for the first 40 hours she worked and she gets paid 1.2 times her regular hourly rate for any additional hours worked beyond 40, and she worked for 45 hours this week?

In the first month, a new program had 60 downloads. In the second month, the number of downloads was three times the number of downloads in the first month. However, in the third month, the number of downloads reduced by 30%. What is the total number of downloads the program had over the three months?

What is the total cost of the pastries that Toula bought from the bakery? She purchased 3 dozen donuts at $68 per dozen, 2 dozen mini cupcakes at $80 per dozen, and 6 dozen mini cheesecakes at $55 per dozen.

Carlos is planning to plant a lemon tree and the cost of planting it is $90. The tree will produce 7 lemons every year, which he can sell for $1.5 each. However, he needs to spend $3 every year to water and feed the tree. How many years will it take for Carlos to start earning money from the lemon tree?

Melanie is a saleswoman who sells vacuum cleaners door-to-door. She sold one-third of her vacuum cleaners at the green house, then sold two more at the red house. After that, she sold half of what was left at the orange house. Currently, she has five vacuum cleaners left. What was the total number of vacuum cleaners that Melanie started with?

In a dance class, there are 20 students. Out of these, 20% of the students enrolled in contemporary dance. After that, 25% of the remaining students enrolled in jazz dance. The remaining students enrolled in hip-hop dance. What percentage of the entire class enrolled in hip-hop dance?

The merchant has two purchase options: jewelry worth $5,000 or electronic gadgets worth $8,000. The financial advisor predicts that the jewelry market will increase by 2.5% and the electronic gadgets market will increase by 1.2% in the same month. The merchant wants to choose the option that will result in the highest profit at the end of the month. What is the amount of profit the merchant can expect to make?

If two trains leave San Rafael at the same time and travel westward for 80 miles, and then travel northwards for 150 miles the next day, what is the total distance covered by each train in the two days?

Jill has two jobs, teaching and coaching cheerleading. She earns $20 per hour for teaching and $30 per hour for coaching. She works 50 weeks a year, 35 hours a week as a teacher and 15 hours a week as a coach. What is her total annual salary?
If Claire eats a 3 egg omelet every morning for breakfast, how many eggs will she consume in 4 weeks? Please express the answer in dozens.

Marissa is hiking a 12-mile trail. She walked the first 4 miles in 1 hour and the next 2 miles in another hour. Her average speed for the entire trail should be 4 miles per hour. What speed (in miles per hour) does she need to walk the remaining distance?

You have 10 liters of orange drink that contains 2/3 water. You want to mix it with 15 liters of pineapple drink that contains 3/5 water. Unfortunately, you spill 1 liter of the orange drink while pouring. Now, you want to know the amount of water in the remaining 24 liters of the mixed drink.

Raymond and Samantha are related as cousins. Raymond is older than Samantha by 6 years. When Raymond was 23 years old, he became a father. If Samantha's current age is 31 years, what is the number of years that have passed since Raymond's son was born?

On Tuesday, Billy sold DVDs to 5 out of his 8 customers. The first three customers bought one DVD each, while the next two customers bought two DVDs each. The remaining three customers did not buy any DVDs. What is the total number of DVDs that Billy sold on Tuesday?
If a candle burns from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM, it will melt by 2 centimeters every hour. What is the total length by which the candle will be shorter after this time period?
What was the original price of last year's best-selling book if Kyle bought it for $19.50 with a 25% discount from the original price?

Marie purchased a chicken meal for $12, 5 packs of milk for $3 each, and 4 apples for $1.50 each. Additionally, she ordered some boxes of pizza, and her total bill was $50. If each box of pizza costs $8.50, how many boxes of pizza did Marie order?

Mishka purchased 3 pairs of shorts, 3 pairs of pants, and 3 pairs of shoes. The cost of one pair of shorts is $16.50, one pair of pants is $22.50, and one pair of shoes is $42. What is the total amount of money Mishka spent on all the clothing items?

If Cynthia eats one serving of ice cream every night, and she buys cartons of ice cream that contain 15 servings each, costing $4.00 per carton, how much money will she spend on ice cream after 60 days?

During his 60-mile bike trip, Henry made two stops. The first stop was made after he had traveled 20 miles. The second stop was made when he was 15 miles away from the end of his trip. What is the distance between Henry's first and second stops?

Gloria is shopping for shoes and finds a pair of boots that are within her budget. She has to decide between buying the boots or two pairs of high heels that cost $5 less than the boots. One pair of heels costs $33 and the other pair costs twice as much. What is the cost of the boots?
If Darrell's age is 7x and Allen's age is 11x, and their total age is 162, what is Allen's age going to be 10 years from now?

Gunter is attempting to determine the number of jelly beans in a jar. He inquires of his friends for their estimates. The first friend guesses 80, while the second friend guesses 20 more than half of the first guess. The third friend guesses 25% more than the first guess. What is the average of their guesses?
If John takes care of 10 dogs and each dog requires .5 hours of walking and taking care of their business, how many hours does he spend taking care of dogs in a week?
Gretchen has a total of 110 coins consisting of gold and silver coins. The number of gold coins is 30 more than the number of silver coins. What is the number of gold coins that Gretchen has?
If Raymond has 40 jewels, Aaron has 5 more jewels than half of Raymond's jewels, and Siobhan has 2 fewer jewels than Aaron, then how many jewels does Siobhan have?
How many points did Mike score in a 40-minute ping pong game, given that he scored 4 points in the first 20 minutes and 25% more points in the second 20 minutes?
If Terry eats 2 yogurts every day and they are on sale at 4 yogurts for $5.00, how much money will he spend on yogurt in a period of 30 days?
If John sells all his 13 lego sets for $15 each, he will have enough money to buy 8 video games for $20 each and will have $5 left. How many lego sets does John have left after selling all his toys?
What is John's running speed given that he runs 60 miles a week, runs for 3 days a week, and runs for 3 hours on the first day and half the time on the other two days?

Dana's running speed is four times faster than her walking speed, and her skipping speed is half of her running speed. If Dana can skip at a speed of 3 miles per hour, and she spends one-third of six hours running and two-thirds walking, how many miles can she travel in total?

If Suzy's iPhone is 1 year old, and Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Suzy's iPhone, then Ben's iPhone is 2 years old. Brandon's iPhone is four times as old as Ben's iPhone, so Brandon's iPhone is 8 years old. Therefore, Brandon's iPhone is 8 years old if Suzy's iPhone is 1 year old.

On mount Farbo, Perg, the great dragon, was perched at a high altitude and spewing fire on anything within a 1000 feet radius. Polly had a gold javelin, which was the only weapon known to kill the dragon. She could throw the javelin for a distance of 400 feet, which was within the range of the dragon's flames. However, when she held a sapphire gemstone, she could throw the javelin three times farther than her usual distance. If Polly holds the gemstone, what is the maximum distance she can stand away from the dragon's flames and still hit the dragon with the gold javelin?

For the fireman's luncheon, Grandma Jones baked 5 apple pies and cut each pie into 8 pieces. She placed the pies on the buffet table for the guests to serve themselves. At the end of the evening, there were 14 pieces of pie left. How many pieces of pie were taken by the guests?

The nutritional information on a 300g bag of chips states that each serving contains 250 calories. The bag has 5 servings in total. If you have already consumed 1800 calories and your daily calorie target is 2000, how many grams of chips can you eat and still stay within your daily calorie limit?

Charlie plans to sell beeswax candles. He can make 10 tapered candles from every pound of beeswax. The cost of supplies for one pound of beeswax and wicks is $10.00. If he sells each candle for $2.00, what will be his net profit if he makes and sells 20 candles?

Meredith is a freelance blogger who writes about health topics and submits to clients every day as her permanent job. It takes her an average of 4 hours to research and write a blog article. On Monday, she wrote 5 articles. On Tuesday, she wrote 2/5 more articles than she did on Monday. On Wednesday, she wrote twice the number of articles she wrote on Tuesday. Find out the total number of hours she spent writing articles in the three days.

Candice had 80 post-it notes in her purse when she left for work at the coffee shop. She bought a package of post-it notes on her way to work. At work, she put one post-it note on each of the 220 cups of coffee. After all this, she had 23 post-it notes left. What is the number of post-it notes in the package she bought?
If John spent $200 on blue ties that cost $40 each, and he bought twice as many red ties as blue ties, which cost 50% more than blue ties, what is the total amount he spent on ties?
Tracy has a garden where she used a wire that is 4 feet long to support her tomato plants. She cut the wire into pieces that are 6 inches long. How many pieces of wire did Tracy get after cutting it?
In Richard's apartment building, there are 15 floors, and each floor has 8 units. 3/4 of the building is occupied. How many units in the building are currently unoccupied?

Lloyd owns a farm where he raises chickens that lay eggs. The number of eggs produced by his chickens every day is 252. Lloyd sells these eggs at a rate of $2 per dozen. What is the total amount of money that Lloyd earns from selling eggs in a week?
If Tom's ship can travel at a speed of 10 miles per hour and he sails from 1 to 4 PM, and then returns back at a speed of 6 mph, what is the duration of his return journey?

Uriah has a heavy book bag that needs to be lightened by 15 pounds. The bag contains comic books that weigh 1/4 pound each and toys that weigh 1/2 pound each. If he removes 30 comic books, the question is asking how many toys he needs to remove to reach the target weight reduction.

The mechanic charges $60 to repair each truck tire and $40 to repair each car tire. On Thursday, the mechanic repaired 6 truck tires and 4 car tires. On Friday, the mechanic repaired 12 car tires and no truck tires. What is the difference in revenue between Thursday and Friday?

The Doubtfire sisters are on their way home with 7 kittens they adopted from the animal shelter. Their mother calls and tells them that their two house cats have given birth to kittens. She mentions that Patchy, the first cat, has given birth to three times the number of adopted kittens, while Trixie, the other cat, has given birth to 12 kittens. How many kittens does the Doubtfire family have now?
Jean has 30 lollipops initially. After eating 2 lollipops, she is left with some lollipops. Now, she wants to put 2 lollipops in each bag. How many bags can she fill with the remaining lollipops?
Peter wants to watch movies this week. He usually spends $7 on a movie ticket and $7 on popcorn. He has a total of $42 for the week. How many times can he go to the movies?

What is the maximum number of identical boxes weighing 15 pounds each that can be loaded onto a delivery truck, which will pass over a wooden bridge that can carry a maximum weight of 5000 pounds? The combined weight of the driver and the empty truck is 3755 pounds.

Stephen ordered groceries online and paid $40.00 for them. He used a delivery vendor, who charged him a 25% fee on the final bill and an additional $3.00 for delivery. Stephen also gave a $4.00 tip. What was the total cost of Stephen's groceries after all the extra fees were added?
How many raspberries are there in total on a raspberry bush that has 6 clusters of 20 raspberries each and an additional 67 individual raspberries scattered across the bush?
In a basket, there are 25 oranges. Out of these, one orange is bad, 20% of them are unripe, and two are sour. How many oranges in the basket are good?

What is the total amount that Janet paid for a brooch that she bought for her daughter? She spent $500 on the material to make it and $800 for the jeweler to construct it. Additionally, she paid 10% of the total cost to insure it.

Assuming Marcy works for the same company for 40 years, she will receive an annual pension of $50,000/year. However, starting after 20 years, she becomes entitled to 5% of the value of the pension per year. If Marcy quits after 30 years, what will be the amount of her annual pension?

If Aleena subscribed to a streaming service that costs $140 per month, and the company charged her the full amount for the first six months, but then charged her 10% less for the remaining six months, what is the total amount she paid for the streaming service by the end of the year?

Sophia wants to take a road trip in her car and needs to know the maximum distance she can travel on a full tank of gas. She has already driven 100 miles since her last fill-up and it took 4 gallons of gas to fill up her 12-gallon tank. What is the total distance Sophia can travel on a full tank of gas?

Jim spends 2 hours watching TV and then spends half as long reading before going to bed. He repeats this routine 3 times every week. What is the total number of hours Jim spends watching TV and reading in 4 weeks?

At a basketball tournament, four schools are participating. Each school has sent a girls' basketball team and a boys' basketball team, with 5 players in each team. Additionally, each team has a coach. What is the total number of people that all the schools have sent to the tournament?

In a buried treasure chest, a treasure hunter discovered gems. The chest contained 175 diamonds. The number of rubies was 35 less than the number of diamonds. The number of emeralds was twice the number of rubies. What is the total number of gems in the chest?
At Dr. Wertz's school, the number of boys is twice the number of girls. The number of girls is 60. The student-teacher ratio is 5:1. What is the total number of teachers at the school?
What was the initial amount of money that Bailey had if she received a weekly allowance of $5 for 8 weeks and ended up with a total of $100?

Judy teaches dance classes on weekdays and Saturdays. She teaches 5 classes every weekday and 8 classes on Saturday. Each class has 15 students and she charges $15.00 per student. What is the total amount of money she earns in one week?

Kelian has two recipes for preparing dishes. The first recipe has 20 instructions, while the second recipe has twice as many instructions as the first one. What is the total number of instructions that Kelian needs to read to prepare both dishes?

Tommy is raising funds for his charity by selling brownies and cheesecakes. He sells each slice of brownie for $3 and each slice of cheesecake for $4. He sells 43 slices of brownies and 23 slices of cheesecake. How much money does Tommy raise in total?

Shiela purchased five cell phones at a cost of $150 per unit. She will pay for the phones in three monthly installments. Additionally, a 2% interest will be charged on each phone. What will be the amount that Shiela needs to pay each month for the next three months?

Artie has a flower stand at the Farmers Market where he sells marigolds, petunias, and begonias. He usually sells marigolds for $2.74 per pot, petunias for $1.87 per pot, and begonias for $2.12 per pot. Today, Artie has no change, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Artie sells 12 pots of marigolds, 9 pots of petunias, and 17 pots of begonias, how much money will he make?

Luke is building a sandcastle at the beach with 4 levels. He observes that each level has half the square footage of the level below it. The top level of the sandcastle has a square footage of 16. What is the average square footage of a level in the sandcastle?

Cecilia has a new puppy and her veterinarian advised her to feed the puppy 1 cup of dog food every day for the first 180 days. After that, she needs to feed the puppy 2 cups of dog food every day for the rest of its life. The dog food bag contains 110 cups. What is the number of bags of dog food that Cecilia will use in the first year?

Sarah does 400 pounds of laundry. David does x pounds of laundry. Sarah does 4 times as much laundry as David. Raymond does half as much laundry as Sarah. Find the difference between the amount of laundry Raymond and David do.

Vincent has two options to buy flowers: either in packages of 3 for $2.50 or in packages of 2 for $1. He wants to buy 18 flowers and wants to know how much money he can save by buying them at the better price.

John recently adopted a dog and decided to take it to the groomer. The grooming service costs $100, but since John is a new customer, the groomer offers him a 30% discount. What is the final cost of the grooming service?
If two girls shared 24 liters of water equally, with each getting 1/6 of it, and then a boy took 6 liters of water, what is the amount of water left?

Charlie initially had 10 stickers. Later, he bought 21 stickers from a store in the mall and received 23 stickers as a birthday gift. After that, he gave 9 stickers to his sister and used 28 stickers to decorate a greeting card. What is the total number of stickers that Charlie has left now?
Grace's weight is 125 pounds. Alex's weight is calculated by multiplying Grace's weight by 4, then subtracting 2 pounds. What is the total weight of both Grace and Alex in pounds?
If Dan plants 3 rose bushes and each bush has 25 roses, how many roses are there in total? Also, if each rose has 8 thorns, what is the total number of thorns on all the roses?
In a football season, a team played a total of 22 games. The number of games they won was 8 more than the number of games they lost. What is the total number of games they won?

Gene is making a quilt using old souvenir t-shirts. He has collected one t-shirt from each vacation he has taken. He arranges the quilt blocks in rows based on the year of the vacation. Gene has been going on four vacations every year since he was 23 years old and he is now 34. How many quilt blocks does Gene have in total?

Greg has set an alarm to remind him three times a day. The alarm keeps ringing until Greg turns it off. Today, the alarm rang four times the first time it went off. The second time it went off, it rang for three times as long as the first time. The third time it went off, it rang for half as long as the second time. How many times did the alarm ring in total?

If a company pays each of its employees $600 in a month and has a policy of increasing the salaries of each of its employees by 10% of the initial salary every year for those who've stayed in the company for five years, what would be the annual salary of Sylvie after three more years of service if she just completed five years in the company last December?
If Marilyn's first record sold 10 times more copies than Harald's first record, and the total number of copies sold by both of them was 88,000, then how many copies did Harald sell?

Christina is organizing a birthday party for 16 friends. She anticipates that 1/4 of the invited guests will not show up. Therefore, she needs 0.75 gift bags for each guest who has been invited. The cost of each gift bag is $2. What will be the total cost of all the gift bags that Christina needs to buy?

Ted the T-Rex wants to bring potato salad to the dinosaur picnic. He is aware that an adult dinosaur will consume 10 lbs of potato salad, while a child will eat half as much as an adult. There will be 20 adults and 5 children at the picnic. How many pounds of potato salad does Ted need to bring to the picnic to ensure that everyone is fed?
If Cindy has four pets, Marcia has two more pets than Cindy, and Jan has three times the number of pets as Marcia, what is the total number of pets that the three of them have?

Emily has 4 children named Amy, Jackson, Corey, and James. Amy is 5 years older than Jackson and 2 years younger than Corey. James is 10 years old and is 1 year younger than Corey. What is Jackson's age?

Lee's time to run the 400-meter hurdles was two seconds faster than Gerald's time. However, Gerald improved his speed by 10% after changing his diet. Lee's time to run the 400-meter hurdles is 38 seconds. What is Gerald's time to run the 400-meter hurdles, in seconds, with his improved diet?

In the neighborhood, there are pet dogs and cats along with pet rabbits. The number of pet rabbits is 12 less than the combined number of pet dogs and cats. There are two cats for every dog in the neighborhood and the number of pet dogs is 60. What is the total number of pets in the neighborhood?
In a group of 200 Grade 5 students, 2/5 of them are boys. Among the girls, 2/3 of them are in the girl scout. The question is asking for the number of girls who are not part of the girl scout.
Last night, Harry slept for 9 hours. On the same night, his friend James slept for only 2/3 of the time Harry slept. What is the difference in the number of hours Harry and James slept?

Freda made tomato sauce by cooking canned tomatoes, which lose half their volume when cooked. She used 16-ounce cans of tomatoes, each containing three tomatoes. Her last batch of tomato sauce yielded 32 ounces of sauce. How many cans of tomatoes did Freda use to make the sauce?

On a motorway, there are 30 cars in a line. Some of the cars pass through the traffic jam in the first 15 minutes. After that, 20 more cars pass through the traffic jam in the remaining 15 minutes. 5 cars from the line take an exit to avoid the traffic jam. How many cars from the line pass through the traffic jam in the first 15 minutes?

Mary, who is an enthusiastic gardener, was given 18 new potted plants from her favorite plant nursery yesterday. She already has 2 potted plants on each of the 40 window ledges of her large country home. Tomorrow, she plans to give away 1 potted plant from each ledge to her friends and family. What is the total number of potted plants that Mary will have left after giving away the plants?

Jerome had 4 friends visiting him on a certain day. The first friend rang the doorbell 20 times before Jerome opened the door. The second friend rang the doorbell 1/4 more times than the first friend. The third friend rang the doorbell 10 times more than the fourth friend, who rang the doorbell 60 times. What is the total number of times the doorbell rang?

Solo has a total of 39 pages to read from his Science, Social Studies, History, and Geography textbooks. He has already read 15 pages on Monday. He has 4 more days to complete all his reading. What is the average number of pages he needs to read per day to finish all his reading?

On weekdays, John drinks a glass of water with breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and one before going to bed. On weekends, he drinks a soda with dinner instead of water. How many glasses of water does John consume in a week?

A city is being covered by a fog bank that is rolling in from the ocean. The fog bank takes 10 minutes to cover every 3 miles of the city. The distance from the oceanfront to the opposite inland edge of the city is 42 miles. How many minutes will it take for the entire city to be covered by the fog bank?

Poppy is working on a jigsaw puzzle that has 1000 pieces. She puts one-fourth of the pieces on the board. After that, her mom puts one-third of the remaining pieces. What is the number of jigsaw pieces that are left to be placed?
If Amir eats 5 cookies, Cody eats three times as many cookies as Amir. What is the total number of cookies that both of them eat together?
John owns three boxes, and each box has dimensions of 5 inches by 6 inches by 4 inches, with walls that are 1 inch thick. What is the combined inner volume of all three boxes?

Frankie has a routine of watching TV after completing his homework every night. On Monday and Tuesday, he watched a 1-hour episode of his favorite show each night. On Wednesday, he watched a few episodes of a 30-minute show. On Thursday, he finished his homework early and watched a 1-hour episode and a 30-minute show. On Friday, he watched two 1-hour episodes as he got to stay up late for the weekend. The total number of hours he watched TV is 7. How many 30-minute episodes did Frankie watch on Wednesday?

Henry is participating in a local baking competition and plans to make twice as many cookies as he made last year. However, he ends up baking 15 more cookies than he intended to and accidentally drops 5 cookies while putting them out to cool. In total, he has 110 cookies. What is the number of cookies Henry baked last year?

If a person purchases 10 gallons of gas from a nearby gas station that is selling gas for $3.00 per gallon, and an app company is providing a cashback of $.20 per gallon, what will be the total cost of the gas after the cashback rewards?

Marcell and Beatrice are competing to eat the most fruit roll-ups. They unroll as many as they can find, but there is a mistake. Beatrice's roll-up is 2 roll-ups wide and 24 roll-ups long, while Marcell's is 3 roll-ups wide and 14 roll-ups long. If they both eat their entire amount, what is the average number of fruit roll-ups they eat?

While Julia was on the lake, her boat started to leak and was taking on two liters of water for every ten feet she rowed towards the shore. She rowed twenty feet in sixteen seconds and the shore was 64 seconds away. What is the total amount of water that the boat had taken on by the time Julia reached the shore?

In a classroom, there are 4 teachers who take turns using a whiteboard. Each teacher uses the whiteboard twice a day for their lessons. The whiteboard is cleaned three times during each lesson. How many times is the whiteboard cleaned in a day?
If Ryan plants 2 flowers every day in his garden and 5 of them did not grow, how many flowers does he have after 15 days?

If Jamal's phone can store 1800 photographs and Brittany's phone can hold only 1/6th of that, then how many photographs can Brittany's phone hold? If the maximum number of photographs that Brittany's phone can hold is 50 times more than the number of ducks in Jamal's photograph of the ducks at the zoo, then how many ducks can be seen in Jamal's photograph?

Sasha bought lumber a few months ago and noticed that the prices have increased by 50%. She decides to sell her leftover lumber, which includes ten 2 x 4 x 10 boards that cost her $10 each and five 4 x 4 x 10 boards that cost her $16 each. What is the total profit she makes if she sells all the leftover lumber?
Katy uses teaspoons of sugar and cups of water in a 7:13 ratio to make coffee. She used a total of 120 teaspoons of sugar and cups of water. What is the number of teaspoons of sugar she used?
If John has 3 children, and he buys 2 pairs of shoes for each child, and each pair costs $60, what is the total amount he paid for all the shoes?

At SeaSide's main port, a customs officer counted 2 containers of imported vehicles, each containing 5 vehicles. The total number of vehicles at the port was 30 the next day, after more containers were brought in. Assuming each container contains 5 vehicles, how many containers were imported on the second day?

If Adrien's salary was 30% higher than Lylah's, and four years ago he was earning $40000, and his salary increased by 40% since then, what was the total salary of Adrien and Lylah four years later if their salaries increased simultaneously?
Miguel uses 2 pads of paper every week for his drawing. Each pad of paper has 30 sheets. What is the total number of sheets of paper that Miguel uses in a month?

Morisette and Kael were asked to bring fruits. Morisette brought 5 apples and 8 oranges. Kael brought twice the number of apples that Morisette brought and half the number of oranges that Morisette brought. Find the total number of fruits that they brought together.

On Monday, Sadie slept for 8 hours. On Tuesday and Wednesday, she slept for 2 hours less each day because she had to complete some assignments. For the remaining days of the week, she slept for 1 hour more than she did on Tuesday and Wednesday. What is the total number of hours that Sadie slept throughout the week?
If Rosie runs at a speed of 10 miles per hour for 3 hours and then runs at a speed of 5 miles per hour, what is the total distance she can cover in 7 hours?

Jennie is currently assisting her mother at her office. She has two piles of letters - one pile contains 60 letters that require stamps, and the other pile contains letters that have already been stamped. Jennie puts stamps on one-third of the letters that require stamps. After completing this task, she notices that there are now 30 letters in the pile of already-stamped letters. How many letters were in the pile of already-stamped letters when Jennie first began her task?

Julia was getting ready for a dinner party at her house and planned to serve stew. She realized that she didn't have any plastic spoons, so she purchased a new package of spoons. Her husband also bought a package of 5 new spoons and gave them to her. While preparing the stew, Julia used three of the spoons to taste it. When she went to set the table, she had a total of 12 spoons. What was the number of spoons in the package that Julia bought?

Dylan was preparing sausage buns for a party and required both chicken sausages and fish sausages. He purchased 38 chicken sausages and a number of fish sausages that was 6 more than the number of chicken sausages. What is the total number of sausages that Dylan bought for the party?
Amy made 20 more friends than Lily after transferring to a new school. Lily made 50 friends. What is the total number of friends that Amy and Lily have together?

At the local store, Dillon needs to buy 4 watermelons, 20 peppers, and 10 oranges. The cost of a watermelon is three times the cost of a pepper, and an orange costs 5 dollars less than a watermelon. If each pepper costs 15 dollars, what will be the total amount of money Dillon will spend?

How much profit does the hospital make from seeing 500 patients per day, with each patient being seen for an average of 24 minutes? The doctors charge the hospital $150 per hour, while the hospital charges the patients $200 per hour.

In Nissa's department store's Santa village, there are 60 seasonal workers hired to play elves. After some children vomit on them, one-third of the elves quit their job. Later, 10 more elves quit their job after kids kick their shins. What is the total number of elves left in the department store's Santa village?
In May, Joseph spent $500. In June, he spent $60 less than he did in May. What was Joseph's total expenditure for May and June combined?

At a carnival, Pam and Fred went on some rides. Pam rode the roller coaster twice and Fred rode it four times. Then, they both rode the luge twice. If each ride required 6 tickets, how many tickets did they use in total that day?

Walt walked 4 miles on Monday. On Tuesday, he walked 6 times the distance he walked on Monday. The total distance he walked from Monday to Wednesday was 41 miles. What is the distance he walked on Wednesday?
If Tom gets 4 car washes every month and each car wash costs $15, what is the total amount he pays for car washes in a year?
If Brian has 20 video games and lost 5 before the comparison, and his friend Bobby has 5 fewer than 3 times as many video games as Brian, then how many video games does Bobby have?

In the world, there are 27 unicorns remaining. Out of these, one third of them are located in the Scottish Highlands. Additionally, out of the Scottish unicorns, two thirds of them are female. What is the number of female unicorns in Scotland?

If Rory orders 2 subs for $7.50 each, 2 bags of chips for $1.50 each and 2 cookies for $1.00 each for delivery, and there's a 20% delivery fee added at check out, and she wants to add a $5.00 tip, what will be the total cost of her delivery order?

Yesterday, Mark took a test that had 75 questions and completed it in 8 hours by answering 5 questions per hour. Today, he took another test with 100 questions and completed it in 6 hours at the same rate. What is the total number of questions that Mark left incomplete in both tests?
How many pink gumballs are there in a candy machine if there are 12 blue gumballs and the number of pink gumballs is 22 more than four times the number of blue gumballs?
Out of the 20 cars available for rent, 12 are automatic and 4 are manual. How many cars are semi-automatic and what percentage of the total number of cars do they represent?

In a hive, there are 700 bees consisting of queens, babies, and worker bees. The number of babies is twice the number of queens, and the number of worker bees is twice the number of babies. What is the number of worker bees in the hive?
If Jordan decides to work instead of playing video games for 2 hours every day, how much money would he earn in a week from his part-time job that pays $10 an hour?

What is the total cost of John's purchase, including milk for 2 dollars, eggs for 3 dollars, light bulbs for 3 dollars, cups for 3 dollars, and roach traps for 4 dollars, with a 10% tax applied to all nonfood items?

Kim has recently started his own housekeeping business and is currently in the process of calculating his profits. He has 3 clients already and is in talks with 5 potential clients. To clean each client's home, he will need 2 bottles of bleach and a pack of cloths. The cost of each bottle of bleach is $2 and each pack of cloths is $5. These are the only expenses he will incur. Kim has estimated that his total weekly income will be $92. To determine his weekly profit, which is the difference between his total income and total expenses, how much profit will Kim make each week in dollars?

John owns a pineapple field that spans 10 hectares and has 100 pineapples per hectare. He can harvest his pineapples every 3 months. What is the total number of pineapples that John can harvest within a year?

Johnny is cleaning up his room and picking up all the legos on the floor. He had dumped three boxed sets of legos on the floor. The first boxed set had 500 pieces, the second boxed set had three times more pieces than the first one, and the third boxed set had 1/4 the number of pieces. How many lego pieces in total does Johnny need to pick up?

Debra is observing a beehive and keeping track of the number of bees that leave and return in a day. In the first 6 hours, she observes 30 bees leaving the hive. In the next 6 hours, she sees half of that number return. In the following 6 hours, she observes twice as many bees leave the hive as she saw in the first 6 hours. Finally, in the last 6 hours of the day, all the bees that had left the hive before and hadn't returned yet come back. What is the number of bees that Debra sees returning to the hive in the last 6 hours of the day?

If Brittany and her mom went to the museum and paid $12 for an adult ticket and $10 for a child ticket, and Brittany's mom gave the cashier money for one adult ticket and one child ticket, and received $8 in change, what was the amount of money, in dollars, that Brittany's mom gave to the cashier?

If Charlie has 12 friends on Facebook and he has three times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy, then Dorothy has 4 Facebook friends. James has four times as many friends on Facebook as Dorothy, so he has 16 Facebook friends. The question is asking for the number of Facebook friends James has.

Steve and Tim are having a race to see who can get home from school faster. Steve lives 3 miles away from school and can ride his bike at a speed of 440 feet per minute. Tim lives 2 miles away from school and can ride his skateboard at a speed of 264 feet per minute. We need to find out how long the winner will have to wait at their house before the loser finishes the race.

Shawnda offers a bike inflation service to the kids in her neighborhood. She charges 25 cents per tire. On the first day, 5 people with bicycles came to get both tires inflated, 3 people came with tricycles to get all their tires inflated, and one person came with a unicycle. How much money did Shawnda make that day?
If Carl purchases ten packs of cookies, each containing six cookies priced at $0.10 per cookie, and pays with a $10 bill, what amount of change will he receive?

Dave purchased a big pack of french fries and consumed fourteen of them before a seagull snatched the pack from his hand. The seagull ate half the number of fries that Dave had eaten. After that, three pigeons scared the seagull away and each pigeon ate three fries. A raccoon later stole two-thirds of the remaining fries, and finally, ants took one fry, leaving five behind. What was the total number of french fries in the pack that Dave bought?

How many hours does college student Kimo spend attending classes in one semester if he has three 1-hour classes on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, and two 2-hour classes on Tuesdays and Thursdays, and there are 16 weeks of school in one semester?

Bill bakes 300 rolls that are 4 inches long, 120 chocolate croissants that are 6 inches long, and 60 baguettes that are 2 feet long every day. What is the total length of all the baked goods in feet if they are placed end to end?

How many bananas does the zookeeper need to order from a local farm every 2 months to feed all the apes in the zoo? The monkeys need 200 bananas, the gorillas need 400 bananas, and the baboons need 100 bananas every month.

Blake and Kelly are having a competition to determine who can run the farthest in 15 minutes. They agree to run on a football field that is 100 yards long. Blake runs back and forth 15 times, while Kelly runs back and forth once before deciding to run to the 40-yard line and back. Kelly repeats this 34 times. What is the difference in distance between the winner and the loser?
What is the total amount Raphael spent on school supplies if he bought 4 pens at $1.5 each, 2 notebooks at $4 each, and a rim of bond paper at $20?

In the pond, Finn initially observes 11 tadpoles swimming. Later, he notices that 6 of them emerge from under a lily pad, and then he sees 2 of them hide under a rock. What is the total number of tadpoles that Finn can currently see in the pond?

On Monday, the depth of water in a tank was 17 feet. The water level increased by 7 feet on Tuesday. On Wednesday, the depth of water in the tank was two-thirds of what it was on Tuesday. What is the depth of water in the tank on Wednesday?

Today, Anakin and Locsin went to the beach where Anakin caught 10 starfish, 6 sea horses, and 3 clownfish. Locsin caught 5 fewer starfish than Anakin, 3 fewer sea horses than Anakin, and 2 more clownfish than Anakin. Can you determine the total number of fish they caught?
How much would a bag of marbles cost after 36 months if the original price is $20 and the price increases by 20% every two months?

If an action figure costs $5, what is the total value of all the toys in the room, given that there are 5 red cars, 3 action figures, and a doll that costs the same as 3 action figures? Additionally, it is known that one red car costs $4.

Jackie is facing a decision between doing her taxes on her own or hiring an accountant. If she chooses to do her taxes herself, she will have to sacrifice 3 hours of freelance work, which pays $35 per hour. On the other hand, if she hires an accountant, she will have to pay $90. What is the difference in the amount of money she will have if she hires the accountant?

Elvira received a budget of €1500 from her family for her 30th birthday. She wants to buy a new computer with accessories and hopes to have some money left over for clothing. At the computer store, she chooses a machine with a screen, keyboard, and mouse for €1090. Additionally, she buys a scanner for €157, a CD burner for €74, and a printer for €102. How much money will she have left to buy clothing?

If Sandra needs 3 eggs to make a Spanish flan and she has to make 15 Spanish flans for her school fundraiser, how many times does she have to babysit her neighbor's daughter if her neighbor gives her a basket of 9 eggs every time she babysits?
What is the current age of Seth if it is known that he is twice as old as Brooke and the sum of their ages will be 28 in 2 years?
If Ethel has $8, Jimmy has $2 more than twice the amount of money Ethel has. How much money does Jimmy have?
On weekdays, Pancho walks for 20 miles per day, but on weekends, he walks only 10 miles. What is the total distance he walks in a week?

What is the total cost of a marching band uniform that includes a hat priced at $25, a jacket that costs three times the price of the hat, and pants that cost the average of the hat and jacket prices?

While walking through the Museum of Entomology, Jake observes 80 spiders, each having 8 legs, 90 insects, each having 6 legs, and 3 rare mutant invertebrates, each having 10 legs. What is the total number of legs that Jake sees?

At the Caboose, there are four birds named Sally Two, Granny Red, Sally Four, and Sally Thirtytwo. Sally Two is older than Granny Red by three years. Granny Red's age is twice that of Sally Four. Sally Four and Sally Thirtytwo are of the same age, which is 8 years. What is the combined age of all four birds?

Jessica has three debts to pay each month: student loans ($300/month minimum), credit card ($200/month minimum), and mortgage ($500/month minimum). She wants to pay 50% more than the minimum on each debt. What is the total amount she will pay in a year?

Billy is getting ready for a family reunion barbecue and needs to make potato salad. He has 60 potatoes to peel and cut, and they are all about the same size. Peeling a potato takes him around 1.5 minutes, while cutting it takes only 5 seconds. How much time will Billy need to finish preparing all the potatoes?

Juan and his brother Carlos are selling lemonade. They spend $3 on lemons and $2 on sugar to make one gallon of lemonade. They sell one glass of lemonade for $0.50 and get 20 glasses from one gallon. If they earned a profit of $25, what was the cost of lemons they used to make the lemonade?

In a race, there were 240 participants who were Asians. Out of these, 80 participants were Japanese and the remaining were Chinese. The number of boys in the Chinese team was 60. What is the number of girls in the Chinese team?

If Zaid earns 6000$ per month, he spends 1/4 of it on rent and 1/3 on car fuel. After that, he donates half of the remaining amount to his favorite charity. He also gives his daughter 200$ for her weekly expenses and 700$ to his wife for groceries and other household goods. What is the amount of money that Zaid will have left after all these expenses and donations?

If Bo has 40 crabs, and Monic has 4 fewer crabs than Bo, then Monic has 36 crabs. Rani has 10 more crabs than Monic, so Rani has 46 crabs. Therefore, the total number of crabs the three have together is 40 + 36 + 46 = 122 crabs.
What is the total amount of money that Lloyd earned for the first two weeks if he charges $10 per hour for Math tutoring and tutored for 5 hours in the first week and 8 hours in the second week?

At Sarai's school, there are two candidates running for class representative. The total number of students who voted in the class was 80. The winner received 3/4 of the votes. What is the number of votes the loser received?

Sandra, a florist who works nearby, is dissatisfied with Fred's delivery because it was incomplete. Sandra had requested four times as many red roses as white carnations. Additionally, she had ordered 200 pink calla lilies, which were five times the number of white carnations. Sandra has warned that she will change suppliers if the missing red roses are not delivered by 5 pm. To retain Sandra's business, how many red roses does Fred need to deliver by 5 pm?
If Jan's age is 30, and two years ago Mark was 5 years older than half of Jan's age, then what is Jean's current age, given that Jean is two years older than Mark?

In a 4 by 400 meter relay race, two track teams are competing against each other. Each team has four members who will run 400 meters, or one lap, around a standard track. The first team has members who will run their 400 meter leg in exactly 55 seconds, while the second team has a less well-rounded group of runners. The first runner of the second team will run their 400 meter leg in 60 seconds, and each subsequent runner will be 3 seconds faster than the previous runner. What is the time difference between the two teams at the end of the race?
Jerry is rolling a die with six sides. What is the percentage difference in the likelihood of him rolling a number greater than 3 and rolling two even numbers in a row?
Jenna and her mother picked apples from their apple farm. Jenna picked half as many apples as her mother. Her mother picked 20 apples. What is the total number of apples that they both picked?

Russell is distributing straw among small rodents at a pet store. The rats are kept in 3 cages and are divided equally among them. Each rat is given 6 pieces of straw. The hamsters are kept in 10 separate cages and each hamster is given 5 pieces of straw. There is also a pen of rabbits where 20 pieces of straw are distributed among them. No straw is used anywhere else in the store. If a total of 160 pieces of straw have been distributed among the small rodents, what is the number of rats in each cage?
Mandy borrowed $100 from Benedict and they both agreed on a monthly interest rate of 2%. If Mandy pays back the loan after 3 months, how much money should she give to Benedict?

A trader purchased bags of wheat from a farmer at a rate of $20 per bag. The trader incurred a transportation cost of $2 per bag to move the bags from the farm to the warehouse. After selling all the bags at a rate of $30 each, the trader earned a total profit of $400. How many bags of wheat did the trader sell?

If three friends bought 3 fair tickets for $20.25 and spent $4.50 less on food than on the tickets, and also went on 2 rides that cost $33 each, what is the amount each person should pay if they split all the costs equally?
If John spends 3 hours collecting peaches and he can collect 2 peaches in a minute, what is the total number of peaches he collects?
If a group of ten ducks needs to consume 3.5 pounds of insects every week to stay alive, what is the amount of insects in pounds that they need to eat each day?
Tom initially has 50 trees. Every year, he plants 10 trees and chops down 2 trees. After 10 years, 30% of the trees die. What is the total number of trees that Tom has left?

Sue lives in a fun neighborhood where her neighbors played a prank on her. On Friday morning, they placed 18 pink plastic flamingos on her front yard. On Saturday morning, they took back one third of the flamingos, painted them white, and put them back on her front yard. On Sunday morning, they added another 18 pink plastic flamingos to the collection. At noon on Sunday, how many more pink plastic flamingos were on Sue's front yard than white plastic flamingos?

Violetta is planning to purchase new crayons in 5 different colors. She has $20 to spend on this purchase and each crayon costs $2. What will be the amount of change she will receive after making the purchase?
If a pencil costs $1.20 and an eraser costs $0.30, and a pen costs the same as a pencil and eraser combined, then how much will 8 pens cost?

In a certain city, there are 40 restaurants that need to be supplied with carrots. The total amount of carrots available for distribution is 200 pounds. Each restaurant is supposed to receive 2 pounds of carrots. What is the total weight of carrots that will remain unused after distribution?
In the city of Soda, the total population is 23786. Out of this, 8417 are men and 9092 are women. We need to find out the number of children in the city.

Elaine had 20 Pokemon cards to start with. After a month, she collected three times the number of cards she had initially. In the second month, she collected 20 fewer cards than she did in the first month. In the third month, she collected twice the total number of cards she collected in the first and second months. What is the total number of Pokemon cards that Elaine has now?

Mark is a copy-editor who edits 1000 sentences every week. He works for two different publishers and edits an equal number of sentences for each of them. Publisher B pays Mark twice the amount that Publisher A pays him. Publisher A pays Mark 5 cents per sentence. What is the total amount of money Mark earns in a week, in cents?
How much water does Baldur get every day from the well if he collects 5 pails of water in the morning and 6 pails of water in the afternoon, and each pail contains 5 liters of water?

If John received an award at work on the first day of the year, which includes a one-time monetary reward of $5000 and a 5% increase in his salary, and he earns $2000 per week for the entire year, what is his total income for the year?

On her 10-acre farm, Josie grows grapes that produce 5 tons of grapes per acre per year. Each ton of grapes yields 2 barrels of wine. What is the total number of barrels of wine that Josie's farm produces annually?

What is the total number of cheese slices that Carl used in a week? Carl had cheese sandwiches for lunch every day of the week, using 2 slices of cheese in each sandwich. For breakfast, he had cheese and egg omelets for 3 days of the week, using one more slice of cheese per omelet than he did per sandwich. Additionally, he made a large dish of macaroni and cheese that lasted him several dinners for the week, using 8 slices of cheese in it.

Janet initially had 22 green pens and 10 yellow pens. Later, she purchased 6 bags of blue pens and 2 bags of red pens. Each bag of blue pens contained 9 pens, and each bag of red pens contained 6 pens. What is the total number of pens that Janet has now?

In Mr. Bert's math class, there are six tests each semester. Students are allowed to remove their lowest score from the average. Brinley has already taken five tests and scored 89, 71, 92, 100, and 86. What score does she need on the sixth test to achieve an average of 93?

Micheal rode his bike frequently and covered a considerable distance. Initially, he rode his bike at least 5 times a week, covering 25 kilometers each time, for four weeks. Later, he reduced the frequency to 2 times a week but covered a longer distance of 60 kilometers each time, for three weeks. What is the total distance that Micheal covered during this period?

Joe has a bag of Halloween candy that contains 25 chocolate bars and 80 candied apples. The weight of each chocolate bar is twice the weight of each candied apple. If the weight of each chocolate bar is 40g, what is the total weight of Joe's bag of candy in grams?

On Monday, Rose bought 4 cakes from a store. The next day, Tuesday, she went to a different store and bought three times the number of cakes she bought on Monday. On Wednesday, she went to another store and bought 5 times the number of cakes she bought on Tuesday. What is the total number of cakes that Rose bought over the three days?
What is the total cost of buying each cup if twenty dozen cups cost $1200 less than the total cost of half a dozen plates sold at $6000 each?

Sara has a desire to purchase a new jacket and two pairs of shoes. The jacket costs $30, and each pair of shoes costs $20. She has the opportunity to babysit her neighbor's kids four times, and she earns $5 for each babysitting session. Additionally, her parents pay her $4 each time she mows the lawn. Before starting babysitting, she had $10 saved. How many times does Sara need to mow the lawn to have enough money to buy the jacket and shoes?

Jerry has a flock of red and white chickens. The red chickens lay 3 eggs per day, while the white chickens lay 5 eggs per day. Jerry collects a total of 42 eggs every day. The number of white chickens is two more than the number of red chickens. What is the number of red chickens in Jerry's flock?
If Gary walks at a speed of 3 miles/hour around the edge of a local park, which is a rectangle measuring 1.5 miles by 6 miles, what is the duration of his walk?

Sloane counted 100 customers on the first day while she was at the dollar store. On the second day, she counted 50 more customers than the first day. If the total number of customers by the third day was 500, how many customers did Sloane count on the third day?

Jerry owns two pools, both of which have leaks that drain 4 gallons of water per minute. Four minutes ago, the big pool had twice the amount of water as the small pool. Currently, the big pool has four times the amount of water as the small pool. What is the current amount of water in the small pool?

Lori has her eyes set on a pair of shoes that cost $320.00 and a matching belt that costs $32.00. She has a part-time job that pays her $8.00 per hour. What is the minimum number of hours she needs to work to earn enough money to buy the shoes and the belt?

Janeth borrowed $2000 and agreed to pay back the loan with an extra 10% of the borrowed amount. She will pay $165 per month for 12 months. What will be the balance remaining on the loan after 12 months?
In the vase, there are 4 roses and the number of dahlias is 7 more than the number of roses. What is the total number of flowers in the vase?
If Harriet is currently 21 years old, and Adrian's age is three times Harriet's age, while Harriet's age is half of Zack's age, what will be the average age of the three in three years?

In a board game, four students scored a total of 251 points. Naomi scored 68 points, Yuri scored 10 more than half of Naomi's points, and Brianna scored 17 more points than Naomi. What is the total number of points that Jojo scored?

Carmen solved 3 crossword puzzles and 8 sudoku puzzles over the weekend. It takes her 10 minutes to finish a crossword puzzle and 5 minutes to finish a sudoku puzzle. What is the total amount of time Carmen spent playing these games?

Initially, a water tank contained 120 liters of water. Celine used 90 liters of water from the tank to water her small garden. After that, she collected rainwater that was twice the amount of what was left in the tank. What is the current amount of water in the tank?
Andy plants 90 geraniums and the number of petunias he plants is 40 less than the number of geraniums he plants. What is the total number of flowers that Andy plants?

In the first year, a company spent $15000 on advertising. In the second year, the company spent one-third of the amount spent in the first year on advertising. What is the total amount the company spent on advertising for the two years?

At the beach, Carlos rented a canoe for $30 per hour and Benji rented a banana boat raft for $18 per hour. Carlos used the canoe for 3 hours and Benji used the raft for 5 hours. What is the total cost of their rentals?

If Andrew plans to travel from New Jersey to Rochester by bus and return by car, how many days will he be traveling? It takes 6 days to travel from New Jersey to Rochester by bus and half as many days to travel by car.

James has a collection of Pokemon cards that includes 30 fire type, 20 grass type, and 40 water type cards. He loses 8 of the water type cards and buys 14 grass type cards. What is the percentage chance, rounded to the nearest integer, of randomly selecting a water type card from his collection?

Chad ordered a build-your-own burrito for lunch which costs $6.50. He customized his burrito by adding extra meat for $2.00, extra cheese for $1.00, avocado for $1.00, and 2 sauces for $0.25 each. He also decided to upgrade his meal for an additional $3.00 which includes chips and a drink. At checkout, he used a gift card worth $5.00. What is the remaining amount that Chad needs to pay?

Kalinda and her mom are working together on a 360 piece puzzle. Kalinda can add 4 pieces per minute, while her mom can add half as many pieces per minute as Kalinda. The question is asking for the amount of time it will take them to complete the puzzle in hours.

At a watermelon farm, 120 baby watermelons were produced. After two months, Ashlyn visited the farm and discovered that 30% of the watermelons were ripe for harvesting, which she took home. Two weeks later, when she returned, she harvested 3/4 of the remaining watermelons. What is the number of watermelons that were not ready for harvesting after two weeks?

What is the total cost that Mark incurs when he purchases a fleet of 12 cars for his company, if each car is sold for $20,000, he pays a 10% tax on the cars, and an additional $1000 for registration on each car?

Kylie and Robert collect shells at the beach. On Monday, Robert collects 20 shells and Kylie collects 5 more shells than Robert. On Tuesday, Kylie collects twice as many shells as she did on Monday. How many shells does Kylie collect on Tuesday?

Dax visited their farm to collect apples and discovered that the number of bugs in the garden was half the number of ants. If the number of ants in the garden was 50, what is the total number of insects in the garden?

There are 36 penguins who are sunbathing in the snow. Out of them, one-third of the penguins jump in and swim in the ocean, and another one-third of the penguins go inside the cave to eat their dinner. How many penguins are still left sunbathing in the snow?

Steve wants to increase his tomato intake and plans to grow cherry tomatoes. He eats 6 cherry tomatoes per day, which is twice as much as his girlfriend. Each vine produces 3 tomatoes per week. How many vines does Steve need to grow to meet his daily cherry tomato consumption?
John wants to share pizzas with his 20 friends, ensuring that each friend gets 4 slices. However, pizzas are only sold in 8 slices. How many pizzas does John need to order?

Ram has a habit of using many pens. He found out that he can save money by combining the ink from five empty pens to make one full pen. Ram decides to buy 25 pens and use them to make new pens when the ink runs low. What is the total number of pens that Ram will have after using this method?
Johnny started with an allowance of $20 and added $10 to it. He invested this amount of money and after a year, it tripled. What was the total amount of money he had after a year?

If Jessa is 20 years old, and Joan is five years older than Jessa, then Joan is 25 years old. Mary is two years younger than Joan, so Mary is 23 years old. The sum of the ages of the three girls is 68 (20 + 25 + 23).

In a school hall, there were 1000 students and 3 entrances/exits named A, B, and C. After a meeting, 30% of the students left through exit A. Then, 3/5 of the remaining students left through exit B, and the rest of the students left through exit C. What is the number of students who left through exit C?

If Robert has x candies, then James has x + 6 candies. John has twice as many candies as Robert, so John has 2x candies. Given that John has 54 candies, we can solve for x and find that Robert has 27 candies. Therefore, James has 33 candies. Thus, John has 54 - 33 = 21 more candies than James.
Dolly and Pandora have a total of three books. They will read their own books as well as each other's books. What is the total number of books they will read by the end?

Mike used to have 5 pen pals, but he stopped writing to 2 of them. Each pen pal sends him 2 letters every week, and each letter is 5 pages long. Mike responds to each letter he receives. He can write a page in 6 minutes. How many hours does he spend writing every week?

If Jason has a phone plan of 1000 minutes per month and he has a 15-minute call with his boss every day, how many minutes does he have left if he has made 300 extra minutes of calls to other people this month and the month has 30 days?

Griffin started with 24 french fries. Kyle took 5 of them, leaving Griffin with 19. Billy took twice as many as Kyle, which is 10 fries. After that, Griffin received a handful of fries from Ginger. Then, Colby took 3 less than the number of fries Kyle had taken from Griffin. In the end, Griffin had 27 fries. How many fries did Ginger give Griffin?

In one aquarium, there are 4 snails and in another aquarium, there are 32 snails. The difference between the number of snails in the two aquariums is equal to twice the number of fish in both aquariums. If both aquariums have the same number of fish, what is the number of fish in each aquarium?

What was the total cost incurred by Jean for hiring her makeup artist for a movie, considering that the artist charged $250 per hour and it took 6 hours each day for 4 days a week for 5 weeks? Also, after the movie was completed, Jean received a 10% discount from the makeup artist.

Isabelle spent a total of $96 on party supplies for her little sister's birthday party. This includes $12 for cake ingredients, $43 for birthday presents, $15 for decorations, $4 for invitations, and $22 for goodie bags. Isabelle, along with her two parents, split the cost evenly three ways. What is the amount of money each person paid?
How much money did the chef spend on onions if they bought 4 bags, each weighing 50 pounds, and the cost of one pound of onions is $1.50?

How many more calories did Sue consume than her sister if her sister ate 5 cookies on Monday and 13 cookies on Tuesday, while Sue ate 4 times as many cookies as her sister on Monday and twice as many cookies as her sister on Tuesday? Assume that each cookie has 200 calories.

In a school, there are 3 classes with 20 students in each class. The school has an equal number of boys and girls. The first class has 15 girls and the second class has 12 girls. What is the number of boys in the third class?
Travis initially had 61 apps on his tablet. He removed 9 apps that he no longer used and added 18 new apps. What is the current number of apps on his tablet?

Yesterday, Rick hunted and killed 10 wolves and 15 cougars. Today, he killed three times more wolves than cougars and three fewer cougars than yesterday. What is the total number of animals Rick killed?
On which floor is Bill currently located if he initially started on the 3rd floor and then took the elevator to the floor that is equal to 4 times his starting floor plus 6?

Shelly took her 3 kids to the water park where Mitchel went down the water slide 30 times. Anne went down the slide 30% less than Mitchel. Robert, the third kid, went down the slide 4 times as much as Anne. What is the number of times Robert went down the water slide?
In a farm, there are ten stalls and each stall has 20 cows. Mr. Sylas purchases 40 cows and distributes them equally among the twenty stalls. What is the total number of cows in eight of the stalls?
What is the total amount of money in dollars that Brady has in his piggy bank if he has 100 pennies, 40 nickels, 20 dimes, and 40 dollar bills?
If a redwood tree is 200 feet tall and each solid 10-foot section of the tree weighs 400 pounds, what is the weight of the tree after termites have eaten 30% of its wood?

What is the total amount that Nancy has to pay for returning 8 overdue books to the library? She owes $0.50 cents for each book and an additional $2.00 fee for having at least one book that's over a week overdue.

If Andrea has 52 apples and she has 8 more apples than Jamal, then Jamal has 52 - 8 = 44 apples. Jamal also has 4 more bananas than apples, so he has 44 + 4 = 48 bananas. Andrea has half as many bananas as Jamal, so she has 48 / 2 = 24 bananas. Therefore, there are a total of 52 + 44 + 24 = 120 fruits.
If two cups of flour are required to make a dozen cookies, how many cups of flour will Carla need to bake 36 cookies today and 30 cookies tomorrow?
In a cup, there are 9,300 pennies. If a stack contains two thirds of the pennies in the cup, what is the total dollar amount of the stack?
Maddison has 5 boxes, and each box contains 50 marbles. She receives an additional 20 marbles from her friend. What is the total number of marbles that Maddison has now?

In Chris's yard, there are 6 trees. Ferdinand has half the number of trees as Chris, and Harry has 5 more than twice the number of trees as Ferdinand. What is the difference in the number of trees between Harry's yard and Ferdinand's yard?
If Carmen has $100, Samantha has $125 ($25 more than Carmen), and Daisy has $175 ($50 more than Samantha), what is the total amount of money that all three girls have combined?

Mrs. Cruz has a budget of $400,000 for a house. She found a property that costs $350,000, but there are additional fees to be paid. The brokerage fee is 5% of the selling price, and the transfer fee is 12% of the selling price. What is the total cost of the property, including the fees, and how much more is it than Mrs. Cruz's budget?

Mr. Tan sold his house for $400,000 and incurred a transfer fee of 3% and a brokerage fee of 5% of the selling price. In addition, he paid $250,000 for the remaining loan amount of the house. What is the total amount of money that Mr. Tan received from selling the house after deducting all the expenses?

Starting with cold oil, how long does it take to heat up to 300 degrees? After reaching 300 degrees, how much longer does it take to heat up to 400 degrees? Once the oil is heated, how long does it take to cook chicken? What is the total time elapsed from starting the oil to having cooked chicken?
What is the total amount spent by a real estate agent who purchased 50 newspaper ads at $5 each and 15 television ads at $75 each?
How many blue golf balls can a juggler juggle if they can juggle 16 balls in total, and half of those balls are golf balls?

Mary purchased 3 bags of M&Ms. The first bag contained 300 M&Ms. The second bag had 12 more M&Ms than the first bag. The third bag had only half the number of M&Ms as the first bag because it had a hole in it. What is the total number of M&Ms that Mary bought?
How many windows are there in total in John's two houses, given that each house has 3 bedrooms with 2 windows each and an additional 4 windows not connected to bedrooms?
If a mother buys cocoa for $4.20, laundry for $9.45, and a package of pasta for $1.35 while shopping and pays $20, what is the amount of change that the cashier gives back?

Terri is making a sweater that has two sleeves, a collar, and a decorative rosette. The body of the sweater requires 900 stitches to complete, while the collar requires one-tenth of that number of stitches. The rosette, on the other hand, requires twice as many stitches as the collar. In total, the sweater requires 1800 stitches. What is the number of stitches required for each sleeve?

In April, Mrs. Rylan has been planting various vegetables on her farm. She purchased 20 packets of tomato seeds and 80 packets of celery seeds for the season. The cost of a packet of tomato seeds is $40, and the cost of a packet of celery seeds is $30. What is the total amount of money Mrs. Rylan spent on buying the seeds?

Sean is preparing for a theater production and needs to memorize lines for two scenes and a solo song. The solo song has 54 lines. In the first scene, Sean has to memorize twice the number of lines as the solo song, but only one-third of them are his. In the second scene, Sean has to memorize six more lines than the solo song, and four-fifths of them are his. How many lines does Sean need to memorize in total?

Carly had a total of 80 cards. Out of these, 2/5 of the cards had the letter A on them. After that, 1/2 of the remaining cards had the letter B on them. Then, 5/8 of the rest of the cards had the letter C on them. The remaining cards had the letter D on them. How many cards had the letter D on them?

Matthew takes 3 minutes to dig a small hole for shrubs and 10 minutes to dig a large hole for trees. He needs to dig 30 small holes and 15 large holes. How many hours will it take him to complete the task?
Mico and Marco want to become acquainted with each other. They discovered that their current ages add up to 20. What will be the total of their ages after 10 years?
Currently, Ruby's age is six times greater than Sam's age. After nine years, Ruby's age will be three times greater than Sam's age. What is Sam's current age?
What was the total amount in dollars that Peter paid for his purchase of 20 popsicles at $0.25 each and 4 ice cream bars at $0.50 each?

In a snake park, there are 40 cobras and 60 mambas. The cobras have 70 spots each, which is twice as many spots as the mambas have. What is the total number of spots on all the snakes if we take half of that number?

Maddy is purchasing pizza for her cousin's soccer game. The soccer team consists of 12 members and 3 coaches. Each team member is bringing 2 guests along. A pizza can serve 3 people. The cost of each pizza is $15. What is the total amount of money that Maddy will spend on pizzas?

Katerina is a designer who specializes in making topaz necklaces. She uses 8 topaz gemstones in each necklace and fills the remaining space between the gemstones with sterling silver beads. The length of each topaz gemstone is one inch, and the length of each sterling silver bead is one-quarter of an inch. Katerina makes each necklace to a total length of 25 inches. How many sterling silver beads does Katerina use in each necklace?

Alani, Braylen, and Margot were asked by their family to write stories of any kind. At the end of the weekend, they were required to read all of the stories they had written. In the first week, Alani wrote 20 stories, Braylen wrote 40 stories, and Margot wrote 60 stories. If they each wrote twice the number of stories they wrote in the first week in the second week, what is the total number of stories they wrote altogether?
Ann's brother is twice her age and Ann is currently 9 years old. What will be the age of Ann's brother after 3 years?
If Kelly has 5 quarters and 2 dimes and she spends 55 cents on a can of pop, what is the total amount of money she will have left in cents?
On a 76-star flag, there are three rows of 8 stars, two rows of 6 stars, and some rows with 5 stars. What is the total number of rows that have 5 stars on the flag?

How many delivery trucks will a landscaping company need to transport 80 flagstones, each weighing 75 pounds, to a customer's yard in one trip, given that the total weight capacity of each truck is 2000 pounds?

If a car in the fast lane is traveling at a speed of 60 miles/hour and a car in the slow lane is traveling at half that speed, how long did it take for the car in the slow lane to cover a distance of 480 miles, which is the same distance traveled by the car in the fast lane?

Ali is a skilled counter who has won 22 medals for his fast counting abilities. His friend Izzy is also a talented counter and has 5 fewer medals than Ali. The total number of medals that Ali and Izzy have together is 10 times less than the total number of medals that have been awarded for counting. What is the total number of medals that have been given out for counting?

If there are 4 adults and 8 children and they have 8 packets of chocolate bars, with each packet containing 5 chocolate bars, how many chocolate bars will each child get if the adults get 6 chocolate bars each and the remaining chocolate bars are shared equally among the children?
If Susan works on an online task that pays her $5 every 10 minutes, and she works between 8 a.m. and 11 a.m. with a 30-minute break in between, how much money will she earn for the task?

There are three friends named Mike, Jim, and Tony who played a game. After three rounds, Mike has 21 points, Jim has 3 points less than Mike, and Tony has 2 times more than Mike. In the fourth round, each player gets an additional point if they have more than 20 points. What is the total number of points for all three players after the extra points have been added?

Will purchases 15 oranges and then requests his two sons to wash oranges equal to their age. The elder son is 8 years old, while the younger one is half the age of the elder son. Determine the number of oranges that remain unwashed.

Darren has decided to do body exercises for a week. On the first day, he did 100 pushups, 50 squats, and 20 dumbbell presses. On the second day, he did 20 more pushups than on the first day, 10 fewer squats, and twice the number of dumbbell presses. What is the total number of pushups, squats, and dumbbell presses that Darren has done in the two days?
In a particular household, every member consumes 0.2 kg of rice per meal. If 5 members of the household eat rice for both lunch and dinner, how many weeks will a 42 kg bag of rice last?

Sam sells bread and his weekly target is to sell 120 crates. However, he was closed on Monday and Friday. He sold 20 crates over the weekend and 15 crates on Tuesday, 12 crates on Wednesday, and 18 crates on Thursday. What is the difference between the number of crates Sam sold and his weekly target of 120 crates?

Carmen attends an auction to acquire an antique desk. She agrees to the initial bid of $200 and proceeds to bid until she emerges as the winner. The bidding price for the desk increases by $50 every time, and three other individuals each place a bid. Carmen bids after each of the three individuals and ultimately emerges as the winner. What is the total amount, in dollars, that Carmen spends on the desk?

If John hires a driving service to take him to work every day, and his workplace is 30 miles away, how much does he pay for driving each year if he goes to work 5 days a week for 50 weeks a year? The driving service charges him $2 per mile driven and he gives his driver a $150 bonus per month.

Peter exercised for a total of 39 minutes on Sunday and Monday combined. He wants to exercise for twice that amount of time on Tuesday. How many minutes does he need to exercise on Tuesday to achieve his goal?

If a tabloid with 32 pages is to be made by folding a piece of paper vertically and then printing page 1 on the left back, page 2 on the left front, page 32 on the right back, and page 31 on the right front, then how many pieces of paper would be required for this purpose?
If Annika brought $50 to the town fair, spent half of it on food and snacks, and an additional $10 for rides, how much money does she have left?

Elise has been selling her Dad's collection of 250 books for three years. Each book sells at 20$. In the first year, she sold twice as many books as she has sold in the current year. Currently, there are 50 unsold books, and she sold 45 books this year. What is the total amount of money she earned in the second year?

If Watson works for 10 hours a day, five days a week, and earns $10 per hour, and the company performs well, he gets a $300 bonus each week. If the company performed very well for the entire month of April, how much money did Watson make in total for that month?
Out of the 20 people John arm wrestled, he won against 80% of them. How many people did John lose to?

The bakery produces 60 loaves of bread every day. In the morning, two-thirds of the loaves are sold. After that, half of the remaining loaves are sold equally in the afternoon and evening. What is the number of loaves of bread sold in the afternoon?

Sandy and Joey want to lose the same amount of weight. However, Sandy needs 4 weeks to lose the same amount of weight that Joey loses in a single week. Joey loses 8 pounds in 4 weeks. How many weeks will it take Sandy to lose the same amount of weight as Joey?

If you purchase 2 tubs of ice cream and 4 packets of milk, you can save some money. The original price of the ice cream tub is $13, but it is now being sold for $11. Additionally, each packet of milk is being sold at a discount of $0.5. How much money will you save if you buy these items?

Helena has created a serum called Lots-of-Limbs that can make a person grow an additional arm every three days and an additional leg every five days. If someone drinks this serum for fifteen days, how many new limbs will they grow in total?

Theo has $6000 for his business trip to South Africa. He spends $600 on 6 business suits that cost $100 each and $150 on 3 suitcases that cost $50 each. He also buys a flight ticket that costs $700 more than 5 times the cost of a business suit. He wants to save $2000 for the trip. How much money does he have left to buy gifts for his business partners in South Africa?

If a family consists of 5 members, where 3 members eat 3 eggs each day and the remaining 2 members eat 2 eggs each day, and they eat eggs every day, then what will be the total number of eggs consumed by the family in a week?
