If Quinn is 30 years old, and Jane is 3 years younger than Quinn, then Jane is 27 years old. Trent is 5 years older than Jane, so Trent is 32 years old. What is Trent's age if Jane is 27 and Quinn is 30?

If Cera is currently 46 years old, six years ago, Noah was half as old as Cera. At that time, the population of Chile was half of what it is now. Six years ago, the population of Chile was 3000 times the age of Noah. Find the current population of Chile.

In a football team, there are 105 members. The number of players on the offense is twice the number of players on the defense. The number of players on the special teams is half the number of players on the defense. What is the number of players on the defense?

Martha is organizing a Christmas party and has invited 2 families with 6 members each and 3 families with 4 members each. Unfortunately, 8 people are unable to attend due to illness. Additionally, 1/4 of the number of people who couldn't come had prior commitments. What is the total number of people who will attend Martha's party?

Solomon purchased 20 marbles from Johanna and combined them with 50 marbles he already had in his store. Additionally, his father gave him 2/5 times the number of marbles he bought from Johanna. Assuming each marble weighs 2kgs, what is the total weight of all the marbles in Solomon's store?
What is the total cost of filling a pool that measures 6 feet by 4 feet and has a depth of 5 feet, if the cost of filling per cubic foot is $.1?

In a classroom, there are 30 boys. The number of girls in the classroom is three times the number of boys. Additionally, the number of nongendered children in the classroom is one-tenth the number of boys. What is the total number of children in the classroom?

In a certain neighborhood, the ratio of electric poles to electric wires required to connect and supply electricity is 1:3. The number of electric wires needed to connect the electricity in the neighborhood is 45. What is the total number of electric poles required by the electric company to supply electricity in the neighborhood?
In the beginning of a party, there were 25 men and 15 women. After an hour, 1/4 of the total number of people left. If 22 men stayed at the party, how many women remained?
If a book costs $4, then a magazine costs half the price of the book, which is $2. Also, a pen costs $1 less than a magazine. What is the cost of the pen?

Jam has three boxes that are filled with pencils and she also has two loose pencils. The total number of pencils that Jam has is 26. Meg, Jam's sister, has 46 pencils. How many boxes do Jam and Meg need to store all their pencils?

If Shannon makes iced coffee by brewing hot coffee and adding ice cubes, and each ice cube cools the coffee by 13 degrees but makes it 12 milliliters weaker, and any added liquid also weakens the coffee, then how much weaker will her iced coffee be if she cools it by 65 degrees and adds 15 milliliters of cream?

Ralph owns a record store that allows customers to exchange their old records for new ones. The store has a policy where customers can trade in 2 old records for 1 new record. Recently, 5 customers visited the store and exchanged their old records for new ones. In total, they left with 7 new records. What is the total number of old records that these 5 customers brought in for exchange?

Jaime works as a computer programmer in a company that has 100 employees. The company pays senior programmers $400 more than junior programmers. The number of junior programmers is 2/5 of the total number of employees, and they receive a monthly salary of $2000. What is the total amount of money the company pays to all the programmers per month?

At the terminal, a certain number of people got on a bus. At the first bus stop, 5 more people joined them. At the second bus stop, 7 people got off and 8 more people got on. The total number of people heading to the third stop was 20. What was the initial number of people who got on the bus at the terminal?

Oscar starts with 24 lollipops. He eats 2 on his way to school and gives 14 to his friends. After school, he buys twice as many lollipops as he gave to his friends. Later that day, he eats 3 more lollipops and 2 more the next morning. How many lollipops does Oscar have left?
If a cell-phone recharges at a rate of 1 percentage-point of charge per 3 minutes and it is currently at 60% charge, how many hours will it take to fully charge the phone?

Erin initially has 7 lollipops. Her mother gives her 10 more lollipops, making the total number of lollipops 17. Erin gives 3 of her lollipops to Ella. The question is asking for the number of lollipops Erin has left after giving 3 to Ella.

If a customer spends $20 at a store, they get a reward of $1 off their next purchase. The customer spent $80 on their last shopping trip and on this trip, they spent $43. They used their rewards and a coupon that was twice the amount of their rewards. What is the total amount the customer paid on this shopping trip?

Nick has two job offers to choose from. The first job, Job A, pays $15 per hour for 2000 hours in a year. However, this job is located in a state that has a total tax rate of 20%. The second job, Job B, pays a salary of $42,000 per year. This job is located in a state that charges $6,000 in property tax and has a 10% tax rate on net income after property tax. What is the difference in net pay between the two jobs, and which job offers a higher net pay rate?

In Scotland, there are 220 castles. Out of these, 40 percent of them are in ruins. Additionally, half of the ruined castles are unmanned. What is the total number of unmanned ruined castles in Scotland?

Robert is planning to purchase a bookshelf and a sofa and has received two offers. The first offer is from Furniture United, which requires an advance payment of $1,350 and 6 monthly installments of $350 each. The second offer is from Cozy Homes, which requires an advance payment of $1,100 and 9 monthly installments of $250 each. What is the difference in cost between the two offers?

There are four people named Nick, Richard, Jason, and DJ. DJ has 8 paintball guns, Nick has 10 paintball guns, RJ has 1 paintball gun, and Richard has 5 paintball guns. If they divide their guns equally among themselves, how many guns will each person have?

If Mason wants to make 8 batches of suckers and 1 batch of fudge, how many ounces of sugar will he need in total? It takes 30 ounces of sugar to make one batch of suckers and 70 ounces of sugar to make one batch of fudge.

If Maria purchases 8 shares of a stock for $8 each, and the stock price increases by 50% in the first year and decreases by 25% in the second year, what is the total value of all the shares that Maria owns at the end of the second year?

Luke ate 2 hot dogs. Thomas ate three times more hot dogs than Luke, which means he ate 2 x 3 = 6 hot dogs. John ate half the amount Thomas ate, which means he ate 6 / 2 = 3 hot dogs. How many more hot dogs did John eat than Luke?

In a class of 200 students, there are three groups. Two of the groups have the same number of students, while the third group has 10 fewer students than each of the other two groups. What is the number of students in the smallest group?
On Farmer Brown's farm, there are 60 animals which are either cows or chickens. The number of chickens is twice the number of cows. What is the total number of legs of all the animals on the farm?

Josh has a school talent show in a month and wants to perform juggling. He starts practicing with 3 balls and adds 1 ball each week. At the end of the fourth week, the talent show begins. Josh drops 3 balls while walking on stage, 2 of which are caught by people in the crowd, but one is lost in the dark auditorium. How many balls does Josh juggle on stage?

If a pink frog weighs 50 pounds and has the same weight as a blue beetle and a green toad, and is 20 pounds heavier than a red bird, but 10 pounds lighter than a yellow snake, what is the total weight of a container carrying one of each animal, including the container's weight of 20 pounds?

Laurel's friend gave her 24 baby outfits that her child no longer needed. Later, at her baby shower, Laurel received twice the amount of new baby outfits. After that, Laurel's mom gifted her with another 15 baby outfits. What is the total number of baby outfits that Laurel has for her baby?

Tyson is a professional athlete who runs 5000 meters every day as part of his training. His coach wants him to increase his daily distance by 1/5. If Tyson follows his coach's advice and trains for a month, what is the total distance he will cover in June?

If Juice Box A costs 4 dollars at a restaurant, then Juice Box B costs 9 dollars and Juice Box C costs 11 dollars. The question is asking for the difference in cost between Juice Box C and Juice Box B.
How many legs are there in total on the tables of a restaurant that has 40 tables with 4 legs each and 50 tables with 3 legs each?

Jenny purchases a bag of cookies every week that contains 36 cookies. She puts 4 cookies from the bag in her son's lunch box for 5 days a week, and her husband eats 1 cookie per day for 7 days. The remaining cookies are eaten by Jenny. How many cookies does Jenny eat?

Davos went to the mall and purchased 2 shirts. The original price of each shirt was $30. However, he received a discount of 40% on the total cost of the shirts. What was the final amount that Davos paid for the 2 shirts?

The factory used to produce tractors and sold 10 tractors per day at $100 per tractor. Currently, the factory produces silos and sells 5 silos per day at $220 per silo. What is the percentage increase in their daily earnings now as compared to when they were producing tractors?

If Madeline has a dog, she needs to buy food, treats, and medicine for it every month. The food costs $25 per week, treats cost $20 per month, and medicine costs $100 per month. If there are 4 weeks in a month, how much money does Madeline spend on her dog per year?

What are the total number of hours Peyton will spend on after-work activities for the week? Peyton has scheduled a one-hour yoga class on Monday, a cooking class that lasts three times as long as Monday’s yoga on Tuesday, a half-hour cheese-tasting event on Wednesday, a museum tour that takes half as long as the cooking class on Thursday, and two hours of errands on Friday.

April bought 100 plant pots from the garden center. She is donating plant pots to a local school for their new garden. The school needs 30 plant pots for the daisies and twice as many for the roses. How many plant pots does April have left over after donating to the school?
Andrea had $36 initially. She saved some money and spent the remaining amount on an $11 sweater and gave $4 to her brother. What is the amount of money that Andrea saved?

During his vacation, John engaged in various activities. He spent 6 hours boating and half that time, which is 3 hours, swimming. Additionally, he watched 3 shows, each lasting 2 hours, which accounted for 30% of his vacation time. The question is asking for the amount of time John spent sightseeing, which accounted for 40% of his vacation time. What is the duration of time John spent sightseeing?

Annabelle wants to buy a phone that costs $400. She has $80 saved up already. At her first job, she earns $10 per hour and has worked for 20 hours. At her second job, she earns $5 per hour and has worked for 15 hours. How much more money does Annabelle need to save in order to buy the phone?

In Eddy's backyard, there are three trees. The height of the shortest tree is 6 feet. The second tree is 5 feet taller than the shortest tree. The height of the tallest tree is twice the combined height of the two smaller trees. What is the height of the tallest tree?
Dean's mother gave him $28 to go to the toy store. He spent $12 on toy cars and $5 on teddy bears. His mother then gave him an extra $10. What is the total amount of money that Dean has now?

Morgan's dad has allocated $90 for her birthday party. Morgan wants to ensure that she and her friends can play one round of mini-golf, have $5 worth of arcade tokens, and ride the go-karts twice. The cost of one round of mini-golf is $5, and each ride on the go-karts costs $10. How many friends can Morgan invite to her party?
If Marisa receives $5 as pocket money every day from her parents and spends it on 4 lollipops worth 25 cents each, how much money does she save in her piggy bank if she does this for 5 days?

Billy's father gave him $10 to buy candy that costs $1.5 per pound. After buying candy, Billy spends half of his change on gumballs that cost $.05 each. If Billy bought 40 gumballs, what is the weight of the candy he bought?
Carver's age is 45 years and he is 5 years less than twice the age of his son. What is the age of Carver's son?

How many days can the train go between services if it travels a total of 825 miles each day, making three round trips between three cities, with the first leg being 75 miles, the second leg being 100 miles, and the third leg being 50 miles less than the combined distance of the first two legs?

Mark is a custom dog bed maker who uses 8 pounds of stuffing for a Rottweiler bed and 2 pounds of stuffing for a Chihuahua bed. For a Collie bed, he uses the average amount of stuffing between the Rottweiler and Chihuahua beds. If Mark needs to make 4 Chihuahua beds and 3 Collie beds, how many pounds of stuffing will he need in total?

What is the total time taken by John to complete his round trip to his friend's house, which is located 200 miles away from his home, if he drives at a speed of 70 mph and takes a detour of 10 miles? On his way back, he takes a different route that is 240 miles long and drives at a speed of 80 mph.

At Small Tree School, there are 96 fourth-graders, out of which 43 are girls. On Friday, 5 fourth-grade girls and 4 fourth-grade boys were absent. What is the number of fourth-grade boys who were present at Small Tree School on Friday?
In the park, there are 6 girls and the number of boys is twice the number of girls. What is the total number of kids in the park?

Jane needs to score a minimum of how many points on her third test to pass to the next school year, given that she must score a total of at least 42 points on all three tests, and she has already scored 15 and 18 points on her first and second tests, respectively?

In Walmart, 3 customers were asked to leave because they did not wear masks. The number of people who were asked to leave for shoplifting was four times the number of customers who did not wear masks minus 5. Additionally, three times the number of shoplifters were asked to leave for getting violent over goods on sale. If the total number of people who were asked to leave Walmart was 50, then how many people were asked to leave for reasons other than not wearing masks, shoplifting, or getting violent over goods on sale?
Erin has scored 14 points and currently has three times more points than Sara, who has scored 8 points. What was Erin's score before?

What is the total cost of gifts for 44 seniors? Each senior will receive a picture frame that costs $20, and an additional 20% cost per frame for etching the logo. Two seniors will receive pins that cost $5 each. One-fourth of the seniors are officers and will receive cords that cost $12 each.

At the market, a hand-painted wallpaper is priced at $400. Ethan decides to make his own hand-painted wallpaper and saves 20% after accounting for the cost of materials. What is the total cost of Ethan's hand-painted wallpaper?

During a weekend sale, a shoe store offered a popular brand of tennis shoes. On Friday, the store sold 14 pairs of these shoes. The following day, they sold twice the number of shoes sold on Friday. On the last day of the sale, they sold half the number of shoes sold on the second day, but six pairs were returned because they didn't fit. What is the total number of tennis shoes sold by the end of the sale?

Hallie had dance practice for 1 hour every Tuesday and 2 hours every Thursday. On Saturdays, her dance practice lasted twice as long as her Tuesday night class. What is the total number of hours she spent on dance practice every week?

A company purchased equipment worth $400000 from a retailer business. However, 40% of the equipment was found to be faulty. If the company returned the faulty equipment to the seller, what is the total amount spent on the equipment that is functioning properly?
Mary has a total of 30 sheep. Half of them give 1 kg of milk each day, while the other half give 2 kg of milk each day. What is the total amount of milk that Mary collects every day?

Mrs. Sherman baked 12 bread rolls for breakfast. She gave one roll to each of her 6 children. The remaining rolls were broken into 8 pieces each and fed to the chickens. How many pieces of bread rolls did Mrs. Sherman feed to the chickens?
In a class, there are 40 pupils. Half of them like blue. One-fourth of the remaining pupils like green and the rest of the pupils like yellow. How many pupils in the class like the color yellow?

Lucy has an orchard where she sells apples for $4 each. On Monday, she sold all the apples she had picked. On Tuesday, she picked 12 apples. On Wednesday, she picked twice the number of apples she picked on Tuesday. Lucy earned $56 from selling the apples she picked on Monday. How many apples did Lucy pick in total over the three days?

Lindsay is doing laundry and suspects that she has forgotten to wash some socks. She has a total of 50 socks that need to be washed. She has already washed 10 pairs of socks and 15 individual socks. How many socks has Lindsay not washed?
If Rachel purchased 23 cookies and Janet gave her 42 cookies, but her brother ate 44 of those cookies, how many cookies does Rachel have left?
Karan borrowed $3,650 at an interest rate of 10% for a period of five months. She has to make equal monthly payments. What is the amount of her monthly payment?
Cho hiked 14 kilometers per hour for 8 hours. Chloe hiked 9 kilometers per hour and stopped after 5 hours. How many kilometers farther did Cho hike?

Axel has 50 silver pesos and 80 gold pesos. When he visits his friend Anna, he finds out that she has twice as many silver pesos as he has and 40 more gold pesos. What is the combined number of silver and gold pesos that they have together?

If Millie opens a lemonade stand and spends $18 on supplies to make 3 pitchers of lemonade, with each pitcher holding 12 cups of lemonade, and sells each cup for $1, and on average sells 4 cups per hour that the stand is open, then how much profit will she make per hour that she spends running the lemonade stand if she sells all of the lemonade?
What was the original size of Mr. Ruther's land if he sold 3/5 of it and was left with 12.8 hectares?

In a choir consisting of 52 members, there are an equal number of boys and girls. The choir plans to perform with only the girls, but due to a bus breakdown, half of the performers cannot make it to the show. As a result, the choir's three teachers decide to join in the performance. What is the total number of people who sang in the performance?
What is Wilson's current math grade if he needs to score 80 or higher to have the car for the weekend and his math grade is calculated by averaging 5 test scores, which are 65, 94, 81, 86, and 74?
If an eraser costs $2 and a pencil costs $3, what is the total cost of purchasing 6 erasers and 8 pencils?

James is responsible for delivering messages from the office to the classrooms of all the teachers. He delivers 66 messages to Ms. Thompson and one-third as many messages to Mr. Yu. What is the total number of messages that James delivers?

David and Dasha went to a carnival that has 9 rides. The cost of each ride is 2 ride tickets, and each ride ticket costs $2. Alternatively, you can buy a ride bracelet for $30, which allows you to ride all 9 rides. David buys a ride bracelet, and Dasha buys tickets. If they ride all 9 rides, how much money does David save compared to Dasha?

Monica is preparing for Christmas by wrapping gifts for her family, friends, and teachers. She has a total of 12 gifts to wrap and wants to make a bow for each gift using 144 inches of ribbon. What is the maximum number of inches of ribbon that Monica can use for each gift bow?

Betty and Sam have a total of 165 popsicles together. The ratio of the number of popsicles that Betty has to the number of popsicles that Sam has is 5:6. What is the difference between the number of popsicles that Sam has and the number of popsicles that Betty has?

If Tim cancels his cable subscription and opts for streaming services, he can get Netflix for $10 per month. He can also get Hulu and Disney Plus for $10 each per month, but he can save 20% by bundling them together. If his cable package costs $60, how much money will he save by cancelling it?
What is the percentage of time Carol spent editing her song if she spent 4 hours writing it, half that much time recording it, and 90 minutes editing it?

Wendy needs to place a certain number of books in a shelving system that has 6 rows and 6 columns. She wants to place 20 more than double the number of books in the system. What is the total number of books that Wendy needs to carry to complete her task?

Erica had initially made 20 Valentine's cards. Her dad later gave her 2 boxes of pre-made Valentine's cards, with each box containing 15 cards. Erica then distributed 24 cards to her classmates and 5 cards to her family. She also received 17 cards from her family and friends. What is the total number of Valentine's Day cards that Erica has now?
Jenny has a pizza with 12 slices. She gives 1/3 of the pizza to Bill and 1/4 of the pizza to Mark. After giving the slices, Jenny eats 2 slices. What is the total number of slices left?
Mark has $50 in his bank account and he earns $10 per day from his work. He wants to buy a bike that costs $300. How many days will it take for Mark to save enough money to buy the bike?

While cleaning her old woodshed, Nancy counted 90 spiders. She also saw a number of millipedes that was one-third of the number of spiders. Additionally, she counted a number of stink bugs that was equal to twice the number of millipedes minus 12. What is the total number of bugs that Nancy counted?

If Erica is 30 years old, and Beth is 5 years older than Erica, then Beth's age is 30 + 5 = 35 years. Alice is 7 years older than Beth, so Alice's age is 35 + 7 = 42 years. Therefore, the difference between the ages of Alice and Erica is 42 - 30 = 12 years. What is the difference between the ages of Alice and Erica, if Erica is 30 years old?
John drank 2 glasses of milk, where each glass contains 8 ounces of milk. If 1 ounce of milk has 3 calories, how many calories did John consume in total?
If a builder works for 4 weeks every month and 6 days every week, and he gets paid $50 per day, what is his total earnings for a year?

Mark is planning to make four times the amount of brownies as the normal recipe. The normal recipe requires 3 cups of flour and 1 cup of milk. Flour is sold in 2-cup bags and milk is sold in 2-cup bottles. How many additional bags of flour does Mark need to buy compared to bottles of milk?

Mel runs a 900-watt air conditioner for 8 hours every day, which means that the AC consumes 900 watts of energy per hour. If he decides to cut down the usage of the air conditioner by 5 hours per day, what will be the amount of kilowatts of electric energy he will save in 30 days?

Jane observed four zebras. Two of them had 17 stripes each, one had 36 stripes, and the fourth zebra had half the number of stripes as the third one. What is the average number of stripes on these four zebras?

Tyson wants to make muffaletta sandwiches for the big game. He needs to make enough sandwiches to serve 20 people, and each sandwich requires 1 pound each of meat and cheese. The meat costs $7.00 per pound and the cheese costs $3.00 per pound. How much money will Tyson spend on the meat and cheese to make enough sandwiches for 20 people?

Allan has twice as many corns as cannolis in his house. He currently has 40 cannolis. He bought 60 more cannolis and 40 fewer corns than the number of cannolis he bought. What is the total number of corns and cannolis Allan has in his house now?

Elliott aims to walk 10,000 steps daily. He completed 50% of his steps while walking to and from school and added 1,000 steps by taking a short walk with his friend. After that, he went for a quick jog around the block and found out that he only had 2,000 steps left to complete his goal. What is the number of steps Elliott took during his jog?

If Toby is reading a book that has 45 pages and each page has an average of 200 words, and he can read at a speed of 300 words per minute, then how many minutes will it take him to finish the book? Toby plans to leave for the airport as soon as he finishes the book, and it takes him 10 minutes to get to the airport. If he has to be at the airport in 60 minutes, how many minutes early will he be?

Carolyn is employed by a delivery service company that employs people on a contractual basis. In May, the company hired 40 employees and paid each employee $15 per hour for a 40-hour workweek. In June, 1/4 of the employees' contracts expired. What is the total amount of money the company paid to its employees for the two months?

Sally went on a vacation to the seashore and her parents gave her $10 to spend. While at the trinket shop, she noticed that taffy was on sale for "Buy 1 pound at $3, get 1 pound 1/2 off" and decided to buy 2 pounds. Additionally, she bought a mixed bag of seashells for $1.50 and 4 magnets that cost $0.25 each. What is the amount of money that Sally has left after making these purchases?

For the fourth of July, Tim purchases two packages of fireworks, one worth $400 and the other worth twice that amount. He receives a 20% discount on both packages. Additionally, he buys a finale firework that costs $150. What is the total amount of money Tim spends on fireworks?

Shannon wants to have enough madeleine cookies to last her for 30 days. She makes her own cookies and eats 2 of them every night as a treat. Her recipe yields 1 dozen cookies. She plans to store the cookies in the freezer. How many dozens of cookies does she need to make to have enough for 30 days?

Marcy produces homemade candles that have a 99% guarantee of not exploding. However, 5% of the more hazardous candles have a defect that causes them to smell like wet dog. If Marcy produces 50000 candles, what is the number of candles that will both smell like wet dog and explode?
If Misha selects 4 blouses from the rack that has a 30% discount, and the original price of each blouse is $20, what is the total cost of the discounted blouses?

Joanne and her sister are gathering apples from their family's orchard. Joanne picks 30 apples from the tallest trees, half of this amount from the shortest trees, and more apples from the average trees. Her sister picks twice as many apples from the tallest trees and 3 times as many apples from the shortest trees compared to Joanne. Her sister doesn't pick any apples from the average trees. Together, they have gathered 500 apples. What is the number of apples that Joanne picked from the average trees?

In a herd, there are camels and dromedaries. The total number of heads in the herd is 180 and the total number of bumps is 304. Camels have two humps each and dromedaries have one hump each. What is the number of dromedaries in the herd?

What is the total distance traveled by Tom during his two-week-long trip through Europe? Tom traveled 200 kilometers every day for the first four days. Over the next two days, he traveled only 30% of the distance traveled in the first four days. On the seventh day, he didn't travel at all. During the second week, he traveled 300 kilometers every day.

If Peter's locker has a volume of 5 cubic inches and Zack's locker is twice as big as Peter's locker, then Zack's locker has a volume of 20 cubic inches. Additionally, Timothy's locker is twice as big as Zack's locker. What is the volume of Timothy's locker in cubic inches?

Stanley was at an elevation of 10,000 feet on the side of a mountain when his comb fell out of his pocket due to a gust of air and landed on a ledge 4,000 feet below. Meanwhile, Stanley's brother Oliver was on the same mountain but at an elevation of 3,000 feet. Stanley called Oliver and asked him to retrieve the comb. What is the total distance that Oliver needs to climb to reach the elevation of the comb?

Mr. Josue needed money to fund his store, so he asked for financial assistance from two banks. The first bank gave him $4000, and the second bank gave him twice as much as the first. He had $5000 in capital before receiving the money from the banks. What is the total amount of capital he has now?

On a rock, there were initially 50 cats. After the arrival of four boats, each carrying away 5 cats, some cats were left. Later, 3/5 of the remaining cats ran after a mouse. What is the number of cats left on the rock?

Bill signed up for a new streaming service and received a special introductory deal where he paid $8 per month for the first 6 months. After that, the price increased to the normal rate of $12 per month. After 8 months of paying the normal rate, the service increased its price to $14 per month. What is the total cost of the service for 2 years?

Cole went to the store to buy jeans for a dance contest. He was confused between tattered jeans and jogger jeans. He decided to buy both as they were on sale. The tattered jeans cost $28 while the jogger jeans cost $6 less than the tattered jeans. He saved a total of $6. He wants to know how much more the jogger jeans originally cost than the tattered jeans, given that he saved 1/3 of the total savings from the jogger jeans and the rest from the tattered jeans.

How many employees of Google can join the day trip if 4 buses with a capacity of 60 employees, 6 minibusses with a capacity of 30 employees, and 10 minivans with a capacity of 15 employees were rented for the trip?

Lillian wants to add bird feeders to her garden as she currently doesn't have any. She builds 3 and buys 3 others. Each feeder attracts 20 birds throughout the day. However, Lillian notices that the feeders she made herself attract 10 more birds each than the store-bought ones. If the same number of birds keep coming to her feeders, how many birds can Lillian expect to see in her garden each day?

What was the total cost of Aleksandra's dinner at the restaurant? She ordered soup, a bagel, and a piece of cake. The bagel cost $4, and the soup cost 25% more than the bagel. The cake cost half the price of the bagel.

Kenny wants to buy a ticket to an amusement park that costs $100. To do so, he plans to sell his Pokemon cards for $1.5 each. However, he decides to keep 1/3 of his collection and use the remaining money to have $50 in spending cash. How many Pokemon cards did Kenny start with?

A caterer was asked to make gourmet hot dogs for 36 guests. He made enough hot dogs for half of the guests to have two hot dogs, assuming most people would only eat one. But 40 guests showed up and everyone wanted a second hot dog. How many guests were unable to get a second hot dog?
What is the total number of letters in Indras and her sister's names, given that Indras has 6 letters in her name and her sister's name has 4 more letters than half of the letters in Indras' name?

What was the total cost of Charlotte's order at the kitchen supply store if she purchased a set of pot and pans for $120.00, a set of mixing bowls for $20.00, and 5 separate utensils at $5.00 each? At the time of checkout, the clerk informed her that there was a 20% discount on everything.

Dora plans to purchase a skipping rope for $6, a board game for $11, and a playground ball for $2. She has $2 saved from her allowance and her mother gave her $16. What is the total amount of money Dora needs to buy all three items?

Prince Thaddeus killed 100 dragons with his sword. Prince Arthur killed 3/4 as many dragons as Prince Thaddeus using a spear. Prince Walter killed twice as many dragons as Prince Arthur using a rusty iron axe. Prince Bruce forgot his sword at home and killed 1/5 as many dragons as Prince Walter using a nail file. Find the number of dragons Prince Bruce killed.

If 15 gallons of gasoline were divided equally into 5 containers, then each container would have 3 gallons of gasoline. Josey required 1/4 of a container of gasoline to run her lawnmower. How many pints of gasoline did Josey need?
George spent $5 on vending machines. He bought 3 bags of chips for 40 cents each and had 1% of his money left. Candy bars are sold for 75 cents each. How many candy bars did George buy?

Ray had a total of 25 lollipops. He decided to keep 5 lollipops for himself and shared the rest of the lollipops equally among his four friends. What is the number of lollipops that each of his friends received?
Rory bakes a cake that weighs 20 ounces. She divides it into 8 equal pieces. Rory and her mom eat one piece each. What is the weight of the cake that is left?
Sitti and Juris purchased 34 and 22 oranges, respectively. They plan to divide the oranges equally among themselves and their 6 friends. What is the total number of oranges each person will receive?

Antoine is making French onion soup for 6 people and his recipe requires 2 pounds of onions, which he plans to double. The onions are on sale for $2.00 per pound and he also needs 2 boxes of beef stock, which are on sale for $2.00 per box. What is the cost per serving of the soup? Please round to the nearest integer.

Wayne and Bernadette are both movie stars and they are going to the premiere of their latest film. Bernadette wants to arrive at the theater five minutes before Wayne. Wayne is staying at a hotel near the theater, while Bernadette is staying in her high-rise apartment in the same city. The drive from Bernadette's apartment to the theater takes four times as long as the drive from Wayne's hotel. Wayne will take four minutes to be driven to the theater. How much earlier than Wayne should Bernadette leave her apartment to arrive at the theater before him?
Billie's bedroom is rectangular and has an area of 360 square feet. The length of the room is 3 yards. What is the perimeter of the room in feet?

If Elizabeth bought 1 pack of red and 2 packs of clear beads, and Margareth bought 3 packs of blue and 4 packs of red beads, and each pack of beads contains 20 pieces of beads, what is the difference in the number of beads that each sister has?

Marcus wakes up to a house that is 40 degrees. He bakes for 3 hours, and every hour the oven is on, it increases the house's temperature by 5 degrees. After that, he opens a window for 30 minutes, and for every 10 minutes the window is open, the house cools down by 2 degrees. What is the final temperature of the house?

If Jon completes a triathlon in 40 minutes for the swim, 1 hour and 20 minutes for the bike ride, and 50 minutes for the run, and James finishes the swim 10% faster than Jon but takes 5 minutes longer on the bike, and Jon wins by 10 minutes, then how long did it take James to complete the run?

If Movie C was 1.25 hours long and Movie B was 5 minutes longer than Movie C, then Movie B was (1.25 x 60) + 5 = 75 + 5 = 80 minutes long. If Movie A was one-fourth the length of Movie B, then Movie A was (1/4) x 80 = 20 minutes long. Therefore, Movie A was 20 minutes long.

If Michael's horse runs at a speed of 32 miles per hour for 30 minutes, how many miles does it cover? Also, if the horse eats 1/2 a bail of hay for every mile it runs, how many bails of hay will it consume? If a bail of hay costs $3, how much will Michael have to pay for the hay? If Michael has six 5 dollar bills, how much money will he spend on the hay and how much change will he receive?

Rozanne is preparing eggnog for her family. She has used 4 dozen eggs from cases and 2 eggs from the cupboard. She wants to serve the eggnog in trays, with each tray holding 5 glasses of eggnog. To make one glass of eggnog, she needs 5 eggs. How many trays can Rozanne prepare?

Before his turn in Scrabble, Joey had 214 points. After scoring 26 points, his total points became (214 + 26) = 240. Marcy, who had 225 points, scored 10 points. To find out how many points Joey is now winning by, we need to subtract Marcy's total points from Joey's total points. Therefore, Joey is now winning by (240 - 235) = 5 points.

What is the profit, in dollars, of a salesman who bought a case of 48 sneakers for $576, sold 17 of them for $20 each at a flash sale on Monday, and sold the remaining sneakers to a department store for $25 each throughout the rest of the week?

Beatrice purchased ten packets of crayons for her Art class. Out of these ten packets, six packets contained eight pieces of colors each, and the remaining four packets contained sixteen pieces of colors each. The question is asking for the total number of colors of crayons that Beatrice bought.

If you didn't buy the movie super ticket and saved $2, what is the regular price of popcorn if a soda costs $3? The movie super ticket costs $20 and includes the right to watch any movie and one popcorn with a soda for an additional $1. Alternatively, you can buy a movie ticket for $12 and purchase one popcorn and one soda at the regular price.

If the total cost of filling up 20 helium balloons was $900 on a certain day, and two days later the cost of filling each balloon was increased by $20, then how much did Bentley pay to fill 170 balloons after the price increase?
During a road trip, a car drives at a speed of 60 mph for 2 hours and then at a speed of 30 mph for 1 hour. What is the average speed of the car in mph for the entire trip?
Jenna has 8 sapphires initially. Later, she trades 3 sapphires for 2 rubies. The value of one sapphire is $800 and the value of one ruby is $1200. What is the total value of all her jewels?
If Marin and his neighbor Nancy eat 4 apples each day, then how many apples will they eat in a period of 30 days?

Bob has a vegetable garden with 10 raised beds. Each bed is 2 feet wide, 8 feet long, and 2 feet tall. He wants to fill the raised beds with potting soil. A bag of potting soil contains 2 cubic feet of soil and costs $12. What will be the total cost of the potting soil that Bob needs to buy?
How many cards are there in a set of magician's cards if there are 15 red cards, 60% more green cards than red cards, and the number of yellow cards is equal to the sum of red and green cards?

Katelyn was playing with her friends in the school playground when she saw 50 fairies flying above the nearby forest. After 20 minutes, one of her friends saw half as many fairies as Katelyn saw come from the east and join the fairies that were there. After 10 more minutes, 30 fairies flew away. What is the total number of fairies that are still present?
Out of Jennifer's 8 puppies, 3 have spots, and out of Brandon's 12 puppies, 4 have spots. What is the percentage of all the puppies that have spots?

How much feed does a farmer need to buy for his horses? The feed includes hay, oats, carrots, and sugar cubes. The farmer only purchases two 1-pound boxes of sugar cubes, as they are a rare treat. He buys four 12-pound bags of carrots, enough to feed the horses while the vegetables are fresh. The farmer purchases forty-two 75-pound bales of hay, which is the main diet of his horses. Additionally, he buys twenty 65-pound sacks of oats, which are a staple to supplement the hay. The farmer's truck can carry 2250 pounds at a time. How many trips does the farmer need to transport all the feed?

Grayson earns money by recycling cans and bottles every week. She gets two cents for each aluminum can and three cents for each plastic bottle. In a week, she drinks three aluminum cans of soda and five plastic bottles of water. What is the total amount of money Grayson earns from recycling in a month that has four weeks?
If Frederick has 10 plants, Toni has 60% more plants than Frederick. Shondra has 7 fewer plants than Toni. How many plants does Shondra have?
If Ali had $21 and Leila gave him half of her $100, what is the total amount of money Ali has now?
If Ashley wants to give a tip that is 1/5 of the amount she ordered, and her pizza delivery costs $15, what is the total amount she should give the delivery man?

In a 100-meter race, Finley initially started in first place but later fell back by 5 spots. She then moved ahead by 2 spots but fell behind by 3. Finally, she jumped ahead by 1 spot to finish the race. What was Finley's final position in the race?

Miss Maria is a middle school teacher who collects sports cards. She has a total of six decks, with 25 basketball cards in each deck, and five boxes, with 40 baseball cards in each box. Out of all the cards she has, she keeps 50 for herself and gives the rest to her students. If each student gets ten cards, how many students does Miss Maria have?

Becky purchased 20 apples at a cost of 45 cents per apple and got a discount of $1. Kelly also bought 20 apples, but at a cost of 50 cents per apple and received a 10 percent discount. What is the difference in the amount paid by Kelly and Becky?

Bob is responsible for washing clothes for a big hotel. In each room, there are two sheets, one comforter, twice as many pillowcases as sheets, and twice as many towels as pillowcases. How many pieces of laundry does Bob need to wash for 80 rooms?

Fireman Frank currently has 200 shoes. On Monday, he receives 5 pairs of shoes. On Wednesday, he gains 15 new pairs of shoes. On Friday, he gains 30 pairs of shoes. However, on Saturday, he gets rid of 180 shoes. How many shoes will Fireman Frank have on Sunday?

Mary has 6 jars of sprinkles in her pantry and each jar can decorate 8 cupcakes. She wants to use up all of her sprinkles by baking cupcakes. She plans to bake 12 cupcakes in each pan. How many pans of cupcakes should she bake?

Theo purchased a pen for $2 and a piece of paper. The price of the paper was $1 less than three times the price of the pen. Theo paid $10 to the cashier. What is the amount of change that Theo received?

In Marissa's class, there are 30 students who each had 10 pencils at the beginning of the year. After two months, 1/5 of the total pencils in the class were used. At the end of the year, only 1/3 of the remaining pencils were left. What is the total number of pencils that were left at the end of the year?

Matt wants to have cookies for a snack, but his dad wants him to eat healthily. His dad allows him to have cookies only if he eats carrot sticks. He tells Matt that he can have half as many cookies as the number of carrot sticks he eats, plus two extra cookies for cleaning his room. If Matt wants to eat a total of five cookies, how many carrot sticks does he need to eat?

Benny observed a shark that was 10 feet long and had two remoras attached to it, each measuring 6 inches. What is the percentage of the total length of the shark that is occupied by the combined length of the remoras?
If 75% of students at a particular grade level have a desktop computer at home, and there are 20 students who do not have a desktop computer, what is the total number of students at that grade level?

If it takes 240 minutes of walking to break in a new pair of shoes and Jason wants to try out for the track team in three weeks, how long does he have to spend walking each day if he can walk 4 days a week to break in the new shoes?
Sarah spent $300 on books when she went to the store. She bought books that cost $15 each. After buying the books, she gave an equal number of books to her 4 kids. How many books did each child get?

In Gina's class, there are 32 kids. Out of these, 9 kids are allergic to dairy, 6 kids are allergic to peanuts, and 3 kids are allergic to both dairy and peanuts. How many kids in Gina's class are not allergic to either dairy or peanuts?
How many employees from the company are going on the tour to explore an ancient site, if the company has divided them into 3 groups of 200 employees each and assigned 7 tour guides to each group?

Tom planned an anniversary getaway for his wife. The cost of plane tickets is $5000 each. The hotel charges 20% more than the normal price of $1500 per day due to a busy weekend. They plan to stay for 3 days. What is the total cost of the trip?

Ben has 4 tubes of blue paint and 3 tubes of yellow paint. Jasper has half the number of tubes of blue paint as Ben, which means Jasper has 2 tubes of blue paint. Jasper also has three times the number of tubes of yellow paint as Ben, which means Jasper has 9 tubes of yellow paint. Therefore, Jasper has a total of 11 tubes of paint. How many tubes of paint does Jasper have?

Belen has two pennies - a 2010 penny and a 1959 penny. The weight of the 2010 penny is 3/4th of the weight of the 1959 penny. The weight of the 1959 penny is 48 grains. What is the total weight of both pennies?

Keegan and Tashay were running a car wash to collect money for a baseball camp. Their goal was to raise $200 for both of them. By 3 pm, Keegan had earned $83 and Tashay had earned $91. What is the amount of money they still need to earn to reach their target?

Gabriel and Luri have portable media players that can store up to 100 songs. Gabriel currently has 20 songs on his player, while Luri has three times as many songs. The question is asking for the difference between the number of songs that Gabriel can add to his player and the number of songs that Luri can add to his player.

Stetson and Alec made a bet that Stetson would give up $10 for each orange he eats. Stetson ate 2/5 of the 60 oranges they picked while they were at the farm. What is the total amount of money that Stetson gave up?
If Jillian's shoes cost $80, and her handbag cost $20 less than three times the cost of her shoes, what was the cost of her handbag?
If James runs 12 miles every day for 5 days in a week, how many hours does he run in a week if he runs at a speed of 10 miles per hour?

Uncle Ben owns four horses and each of them eats 5 pounds of oats per meal. He feeds them twice a day and wants to know how many bags of oats he needs to feed them for five days. If one bag contains 50 pounds of oats, what is the total number of bags of oats that Uncle Ben needs to feed his horses for five days?

Jana is a dog owner who has 27 puppies. Out of all the puppies, two-thirds of them are Pomeranians. Additionally, one-third of the Pomeranians are female. What is the total number of female Pomeranians that Jana has?

What is the average of the highest temperatures ever recorded in Southlandia, Northlandia, and Midlandia, which are -48 degrees Fahrenheit, 21 degrees Fahrenheit, and -3 degrees Fahrenheit, respectively?

If an 8-year old child has $4 savings and wants to buy a toy car that costs $12, and he promises to save $2 daily from his allowance, how many days will it take him to save the remaining amount of money?
Jaime has 64 eggs and he wants to place them on trays. Each tray can hold 24 eggs. He has 2 trays. How many eggs will be left that he won't be able to place on the trays?
If Sally purchases a small pizza for $8 and a family-size pizza that costs three times more than the small pizza, what is the total amount she spends?

Heather wants to buy 2 packs of razors, where each pack contains 4 razors and costs $4.00. The razors are currently on sale for buy one get one free, and she also has a $2.00 coupon. What will be the cost of each individual razor, in cents, after applying the discount?

If there are 10 cheerleaders, 9 of them are 64 inches tall and the remaining one is 60 inches tall. They want to build a human pyramid with 4 girls at the bottom, 3 on top of them, 2 on top of the 3, and the shortest girl at the top. What is the height of the human pyramid in feet?

Charisma works for 5 days, 8 hours each day. During her work hours, she sets a timer to remind her to walk for 5 minutes every hour. What is the total number of minutes Charisma has walked after 5 days at the office?
Brett's current age is 14 years. In four years, his sister Angela's age will be three times Brett's current age. What is Angela's current age?

Over a period of 14 days, Paul drives his car twice a day - once in the morning and once in the afternoon. He spends approximately $6 for each morning ride and approximately $2 for each afternoon ride. What is the total amount of money that Paul spends on driving his car during these two weeks?

Brianne and Ashley are making Greek orange pie. Ashley brought five boxes, and each box contains ten oranges. Brianne brought 20 more oranges than Ashley. To make one Greek orange pie, three oranges are needed. How many Greek orange pies can they make?

Mark is planning a surprise party for his wife and is considering two venues. The first venue charges a fixed fee of $200, irrespective of the number of guests attending. The second venue charges $25 per person attending, but food is included in the price. Mark estimates that food will cost $5 per person at the first venue. What is the minimum number of guests required for the cost of both venues to be the same?

Lily, David, and Bodhi collected a total of 43 insects. Lily found 7 more insects than David did. David found half the number of insects that Bodhi found. What is the number of insects that Lily found?

Mariah and her grandma were knitting together. Mariah used 1/4 of a skein of yarn, and her grandma used 1/2 of a skein of yarn. It is known that there are 364 yards in a skein of yarn. What is the total number of yards of yarn that they used?

Cherrie has 5 friends whom she wants to buy Christmas gifts for. Out of these 5 friends, 2 of them want 5 gifts each while the other 3 friends want 2 gifts each. Cherrie decides to buy all the gifts and also adds 10 more random gifts to surprise her friends. What is the total number of gifts that Cherrie bought?

If the chair is 3 feet wide, and the rug is 5 feet wider than the chair, then the rug is 8 feet wide. Also, the couch is 2 feet longer than twice the width of the rug. Therefore, the couch is 2(8) + 2 = 18 feet long. How long is the couch in feet?

Suzie purchased four packs of fruit-flavored gum during her last visit to the store. Two of the packs were of her favorite flavor, strawberry. She also bought a pack of grape gum for $2 and a small pack of green apple gum for half the price of the grape gum. In total, she spent $7. What was the cost of each pack of strawberry gum?

Frederick is producing popsicles for sale and wants to save money by creating his own popsicle sticks. He can obtain 200 sticks from a 2 x 4 piece of wood and 400 sticks from a 2 x 8 piece of wood. He has $24 to spend on wood for sticks, and a 2 x 4 piece of wood costs $4 while a 2 x 8 piece of wood costs $6. If he purchases the cheapest lumber, what is the maximum number of popsicle sticks he can create?

Mario has 6 sled dogs and he wants to buy snowshoes for all of them. Each dog has four legs and a pair of snowshoes costs $12.00. What will be the total cost for Mario to buy snowshoes for all of his dogs?
If Janet takes two bus trips every day for five days in a week and each trip costs her $2.20, what amount of money would she save if she purchases a weekly bus pass for $20?

In total, how many cows and sheep are there between the farm and the zoo? The farm has 30 cows and the zoo has 20 sheep. Additionally, the zoo has double the number of cows that the farm has, while the farm has half the number of sheep that the zoo has.

Sophia and Rose went to the market together to purchase onions and potatoes. Rose bought 12 onions and 4 potatoes, which is four times the number of onions and potatoes Sophia bought. What is the total number of onions and potatoes that Sophia bought at the market?

Andy has set a New Year's resolution to lose 30 lbs. before his birthday on July 19th. He plans to achieve this by burning 3500 calories for every pound he loses. Today's date is December 31st. What is the daily calorie deficit (the difference between the calories he burns and consumes) that Andy needs to maintain in order to reach his goal?
Gerald works at a daycare and earns $30 per day. He worked for a week and spent $100 in total. What is the amount of money he has left?
If Hannah runs 8 laps, each of which is 0.25 km long, and she needs to drink 60 ml of water for every kilometer she runs, how many milliliters of water will she need to drink?

Julie had $500. She spent 20% of it on clothes, which means she spent $100 on clothes. After that, she had $400 left. Then, she spent 25% of the remaining money on CDs, which means she spent $100 on CDs. How much money did Julie have left after buying clothes and CDs?
If a house and a lot together cost $120,000 and the cost of the house is three times the cost of the lot, what is the cost of the house?

Tara purchased 8 sets of canvas bags, with each set containing 5 bags, at a cost of $4 per set. After painting them, she sold each bag for $8 at a craft fair. What was the total profit that she earned from selling the bags?
On average Joe throws 25 punches per minute.  A fight lasts 5 rounds of 3 minutes.  How many punches did he throw?

In an eighth-grade class bake-off, Kelsie made twice the number of cookies that Josh made. Josh made only one-fourth of the number of cookies that Suzanne made. If Suzanne made 36 cookies, how many cookies did Kelsie make?

Ali worked for Mr. James on his farm and saved four $10 bills and six $20 bills. He gave half of his total money to his sister and then used 3/5 of the remaining amount to buy dinner. What is the amount of money he has left after buying dinner?
If it takes Rob 2 hours to shingle a house, and Royce takes 40 minutes more than double the time taken by Rob to shingle the same house, then how many minutes does Royce take to shingle the house?

To make a hat, she needs 2 skeins of wool, 4 for a scarf, 12 for a sweater, 1 for a pair of mittens, and 2 for a pair of socks. What is the total number of skeins of wool that Martha needs to buy for this project?

On Wednesday, he completes one-quarter of the remaining math problems. Given this information, how many math problems does Chris have left to complete on Thursday?

Kathy can pick twice as many strawberries in an hour as Bobby. Ricky can pick two quarts less than Kathy in an hour. What is the total number of quarts of strawberries that Tony, Bobby, Ricky, and Kathy can pick in an hour on Grandma Concetta's farm?

On Monday morning, the bakers at the Beverly Hills Bakery baked a total of 200 loaves of bread. Out of these, they sold 93 loaves in the morning and 39 loaves in the afternoon. Later, a grocery store returned 6 unsold loaves. What is the total number of loaves of bread that the bakery has left?

Heather wants to divide the raisins equally among the three recipes. A batch of oatmeal cookies requires 3/4 of a cup of raisins. How many batches of oatmeal cookies can Heather make using the entire bag of raisins?

Ada's current daily electric consumption is 12 kilowatts per hour. She intends to include a new device that will consume 2 kilowatts per hour a day. The cost of a kilowatt per hour is $1.50. What is the difference between Ada's weekly electric bill before and after she adds the new device?
Suppose one person can paint half of a house in 5 days. How many hours would it take for a group of 5 people to paint an entire house?

In the same apartment building, Ophelia and Jenna have a different number of chairs and sofas. Each of them has two fewer sofas than chairs. Ophelia has 20 sofas, while Jenna has three times as many chairs as Ophelia. Determine the total number of chairs and sofas that they have combined.

For two consecutive weeks, he worked out for 5 hours each week, and in one week, he worked out for 6 hours. What is the total number of hours that Josh has spent working out over the 8 weeks?

Jame's current age is not mentioned in the question. However, we know that he will turn 27 in 5 years. In 8 years, Jame's cousin will be 5 years younger than twice Jame's age at that time. We need to find the age difference between Jame and his cousin currently.
Errol spent $2,400 on a computer, 2 monitors, and a printer. He paid $400 less for the printer than the computer, which cost $1,100. What is the cost of one monitor, in dollars?

If the dinner bill was $50 and your wife wants to split it evenly, but you have to pay an extra 20% tip, how much did you end up paying in total?
