Aries is taking a quiz that has 60 questions. Out of these, 40% of the questions are easy, and the remaining questions are equally divided into average and difficult categories. Aries is confident that she can answer 75% of the easy questions correctly. For the average and difficult questions, she is sure that she can answer half of them correctly. What is the total number of points that Aries is sure to get?

Teresa sells large stuffed animals at a price that is one-third of the price of the small stuffed animals. Today, she sold twice as many small stuffed animals as large ones and earned $120 from the sales. The cost of each small stuffed animal is $4. How many small stuffed animals did Teresa sell?
In a day, the man eats 5 sandwiches, his wife eats 4 sandwiches, and their son eats 2 sandwiches. How many sandwiches does this family eat in a week?

Suzanne earned money by selling 80 cookies at a price of $1 per cookie and 60 cupcakes at a price of $4 per cupcake. She gave $10 each to her two sisters for helping her. What is the amount of money that Suzanne has left after giving her sisters their share?
In an Easter egg hunt, a team hid a total of 100 eggs. The Smith twins found 30 eggs each, leaving 10 eggs for their friends to find. How many eggs did the friends find in total?

If one dwarf can mine 12 pounds of ore per day using his bare hands, he can mine twice as much with an iron pickaxe and 50% more with a steel pickaxe than with an iron pickaxe. There are 40 dwarves with steel pickaxes who will be mining for 30 days. How many pounds of ore can they mine in total?

There is a store that sells sandwiches in three different package sizes. The first package has 2 sandwiches and costs $3. The second package has 4 sandwiches and costs $6. The third package has 8 sandwiches, but the price is not mentioned. It is known that the prices are proportional. What is the cost of the package with 8 sandwiches?
Tom purchased a bedroom set for $3000. He paid $1000 for it by selling his old bedroom set. He needs to pay 10% of the remaining amount every month. What is the monthly payment amount?

Sally was walking to school while holding 25 red balloons, 7 green balloons, and 12 yellow balloons. Due to a gust of wind, 40% of the red balloons burst, which startled Sally. She accidentally released half of the yellow balloons. However, she found 8 blue balloons caught in a tree near the school and added 75% of them to her remaining balloons. What is the total number of balloons that Sally carried into the school?

What is the probability that Marcus will have to submit his homework tomorrow, given that there is a 50% chance of having a substitute teacher who won't collect the homework, a 40% chance of getting an extension from the regular teacher, and a 20% chance of convincing the teacher for a personal extension by claiming that his dog ate his assignment?

If Apple High School is hosting graduation in their Fine Arts Center, which can accommodate 6000 people, and 950 seats are reserved for graduates and 300 seats for faculty, then how many tickets will each graduate receive to distribute among their friends and family if the tickets are divided equally?

Grandpa has a fondness for jelly beans, but the number of jelly beans he can consume is determined by their size. To satiate his hunger, he requires 75 large jelly beans. He can consume twice as many medium-sized beans as large ones. Additionally, eating three small beans is equivalent to eating one medium-sized bean. What is the number of small beans that Grandpa can eat?

Melissa has been called for jury duty and has spent 6 hours a day for 3 days listening to a court case. She receives $15 per day as jury pay but has to pay $3 for parking each day. What is the amount of jury pay that Melissa earns per hour after deducting the parking expenses?
Ted had $200 initially. He spent $16 on each of the 3 books he bought and $6 on each of the 3 pencils he bought. What is the total amount of money he spent?

Richard plans to create a video of a science experiment where he puts a specific branded candy in a bottle of diet soda to create a fountain. He wants to place the bottles of soda every 3 feet of his 24 feet wide driveway. Richard takes 5 seconds to move from one bottle to the next and drop the candy in. What is the total time Richard will take to set off all the soda fountains?

In one box, there are forty apples. Uncle Franky has ordered two boxes of apples. He intends to pack the apples with eight apples in each pack. How many packs of apples can he make with the two boxes of apples?
If Amor has $50 cash and she buys 2 pounds of Parmesan cheese at $11 per pound and 3 pounds of mozzarella cheese at $6 per pound, how much money will she have left in dollars to buy meat?

Jim wants to increase his income by going to college for 4 years. He takes out $50,000 in loans each year. Before college, he had a job that paid $25,000 per year. After college, his income triples. How long will it take for him to earn enough money to pay off his loans and make up for the income he lost while in school?

Jim wants to make a comforter for his king-sized bed, which is 6 feet long and 8 feet wide. He needs two pieces of fabric that are 2 feet longer and 2 feet wider than the bed. What is the total area of fabric that Jim needs to buy?

How many letters did the post office deliver from Monday to Wednesday? On Monday, they delivered 425 letters. On Tuesday, they delivered 17 more than one-fifth of the number of letters delivered on Monday. On Wednesday, they delivered 5 more than twice the number of letters delivered on Tuesday.

Molly is organizing a birthday party for her sister and has invited 16 guests. Out of these guests, 10 have requested chicken salad which costs $6.50 per person, and 6 have requested pasta salad which costs $6 per person. What is the total cost that Molly will have to pay for the catering?

Johnny's dad took him to watch horse racing and placed bets. In the first race, he lost $5. In the second race, he won $1 more than twice the amount he lost in the first race. In the third race, he lost 1.5 times the amount he won in the second race. What was the average amount of money he lost that day?

In South America, there are 26 countries and each country has 5 cities. In each city, there are 1000 people living. If all the people in South America live in these cities, what is the total population of South America?

Ava noticed that her friends Cole and Xavier have grown taller on the first day of school. Xavier was initially 4 feet tall and grew 3 inches, while Cole was 50 inches tall and grew 2 inches during the summer. What is the difference between the current heights of Cole and Xavier?

If three people divide an amount of $1920, and the second person takes $80 more than the first person, while the third person takes twice what the second person took, what is the share of the first person?
If a team of 4 painters worked on a mansion for 3 weeks, spending 3/8ths of a day every day on the job, what is the total number of hours each painter worked?

Rory is picking up tennis balls from the court after playing a tennis match. He retrieved a total of 19 tennis balls. During the first set, he had to retrieve four more balls than in the second set. In the third set, he retrieved half as many balls as he did in the second set. What is the number of tennis balls that Rory retrieved in the first set of the match?
In 2007, Ben purchased a car for $20000. The car's value decreases by 21% every year. What is the value of the car in the year 2010?
In a small library, there are 50 books. Out of these, half of the books are in English and 10% of the books are in German. The remaining books are in Spanish. What is the number of books in Spanish?

Bernice is planning to drive from San Diego, California to New York City, New York which is approximately 1955 kilometers away. She has already driven 325 kilometers for 4 days. What is the total number of kilometers she still needs to drive to reach her destination?
If Ingrid drinks 8 cups of water every day, how many cups of water does she drink in 30 days? Also, if there are 16 cups in a gallon, how many gallons of water does she consume in 30 days?

Romeo gets on a train that already has 120 people. At the first stop, 20 more people get on. At the second stop, 50 people get off while twice that number get on. At the third stop, 80 people get off. What is the total number of people on the train at the end of the journey?

Alison made it to the running team and decided to buy some athletic gear. She purchased a tank top for $10, a pair of running shorts for $15, and a pair of tennis shoes that were originally $48 but were on sale for $24. Additionally, she bought a package of athletic socks for $8 but used a $2 coupon. What was the total amount of money Alison spent on her athletic gear?

To renovate my kitchen floor, I need to install new square floor tiles that cost $12 each. The total area of my kitchen floor is 200 SqFt, and each tile side is 1ft in length. What will be the total cost of renovating my kitchen floor?
If James has to purchase insurance and the cost is 60% more than the normal cost of $120 per month due to an accident, what is the total amount he pays for insurance in a year?

Every week, Greg changes the sheets on 4 twin beds and 1 king size bed. He can only wash 2 twin sets of sheets and 1 king set of sheets at a time. What is the total number of loads of laundry that Greg does in a year?

Jill and her friends watch 4 movies every Saturday. On Sundays, they watch half the number of movies they watch on Saturdays. They watch movies every weekend. How many movies can they watch in a period of 4 weeks?

Leo has a sticker collection. Two years ago, he had 100 stickers in his collection. Last year, he added 50 stickers to his collection. This year, he collected twice the number of stickers he collected last year. What is the total number of stickers in Leo's collection?
If Imma has 3 cats and she feeds each of them 60 grams of cat food twice a day, then how many days will 720 grams of cat food last?

Becky, Jake, and Silvia shared 4 pizzas, where each pizza had 8 slices. Becky ate 3 more slices than Jake, and Silvia ate twice as many slices as Jake. Given that Becky ate 10 slices, what is the total number of slices that they ate altogether?
Betsy and Donovan collaborated to prepare a meal that took 98 minutes to make. Betsy's contribution to the meal took 18 minutes longer than Donovan's. What is the duration of Betsy's part in minutes?

What is the total cost of Hannah's visit to the doctor after slipping on a banana peel and breaking her arm, including the cost of the cast ($200), the 30-minute visit fee ($300/hour), the painkillers ($4/pill for 30 pills), and the parking fee ($6/hour for a minimum of 2 hours)?
If James receives 80 emails per day, and 20% of them do not require a response, how many emails does he respond to during a 5-day work week?

Last week, the Science Center organized field trips from Monday to Friday. On Monday, 32 classes visited the center. On Tuesday, twice the number of classes that visited on Monday came to the center. On Wednesday, three times the number of classes that visited on Monday came to the center. On Thursday, 30 classes visited the center and on Friday, 25 classes visited. What is the total number of classes that visited the Science Center last week?
What is the average score of John on all four tests if he scored 100 on the first three tests and 80 on the fourth test?
The glee club ordered 20 pizzas and consumed 70% of them. The football team ordered twice as many pizzas as the glee club and consumed 80% of them. How many pizzas are remaining?

Anthony is planning to send coupons for his pizza parlor through the mail. He wants to send out a total of 700 small coupons and twice as many big coupons. The cost of mailing each small coupon is 5 cents and each big coupon costs 15 cents. What is the total amount of money Anthony will spend on postage for all the coupons?

If one meatball sub sandwich contains 4 meatballs, and Sidney ordered 3 less than ten meatball sub sandwiches, but Mark ate 4 of Sidney's meatball sub sandwiches, then Sidney ordered another three sub sandwiches. The question is asking how many meatballs were in the sub sandwiches that were not eaten by Mark.

Mr Hezekiah dispatched 20 trucks carrying 20 tons of fertiliser each in bags to different farmers in his hometown. However, two hours after the trucks had left, he received news that a quarter of the trucks had mechanical failures on the road and could not deliver the fertilisers to the farmers. What is the total amount of fertiliser in tons that was delivered to the farmers on that day?

Dennis needs to make 6 dozen croissants and uses 1 pound of butter for every dozen croissants. The grocery store has a promotion where buying one pound of butter gets one half off. The cost of one pound of butter is $4.00. What will be the cost of purchasing 6 pounds of butter?

Kayla is celebrating her birthday at a movie theater. The rental fee for the theater is $125 for a group of 20 people, and an additional $6 for each extra person. Kayla has invited 25 classmates, 7 girls from her dance class, and 13 family members. Only 4 people declined the invitation. What is the total cost of the party?
Maggie and Riza each had $60. Maggie spent 1/4 of her money and Riza spent 1/3 of her money. What is the total amount of money that Maggie and Riza have left?

Mr. Robles has three monkeys to feed for a week and he buys 315 bananas for this purpose. The first monkey eats 10 bananas per day, the second monkey eats 4 more bananas than the first monkey, and the third monkey eats the remaining bananas for the day. What is the number of bananas that the third monkey eats each day?
Teddy completed half of a 500 piece puzzle and then completed another 500 piece puzzle within an hour. What is the total number of puzzle pieces that Teddy completed during that hour?

Jenny visits a florist to purchase flowers. The cost of one rose is $2 and a dozen roses cost $15. She buys 15 roses and pays with five 5 dollar bills. The florist can only provide change in quarters. What is the total number of quarters that Jenny receives as change?
If Terry sells 6 milkshakes at a price of $5.50 each, 9 burger platters at a price of $11 each, and 20 sodas at a price of $1.50 each, what is the total amount of money he earns?

At the train station, Paul is waiting for his train, which is the fourth train scheduled to arrive. He doesn't know how long he needs to wait. The first train is scheduled to arrive in 10 minutes and will stay for 20 minutes. The second train will arrive half an hour after the first train leaves and will stay for a quarter of the time that the first train stayed. The third train will arrive an hour after the second train leaves and will leave immediately after it arrives. The fourth train, which Paul needs to board, will arrive 20 minutes after the third train leaves. What is the total time, in minutes, that Paul will have to wait for his train?

Melanie wants to make a toothpick sculpture for which she needs 200 toothpicks. She found a blueprint online and started saving toothpicks from her mom's sandwiches. She has saved 10 toothpicks each week for the past 12 weeks. If she continues at the same rate, how many more weeks will it take her to collect 200 toothpicks?

A watch worth $2000 was sold at a discount of 25% to Mr. Rogers. He then sold the same watch to his friend at a markup of 20% from the price he bought it. What percentage discount did Mr. Roger's friend get from the original price of the watch?
Suppose there are 5 bubbling springs that create a new jellyfish every second. How many jellyfish would be created by these 5 springs working at the same rate in a time span of 4 hours?
Frankie and Binkie went bowling together and Binkie's score was 90. Frankie's score was 15 more than twice as high as Binkie's score. What was Frankie's score?

James walked to the store but realized he forgot something at home when he was halfway there. His home is 4 miles away from the store and he walks at a speed of 4 miles per hour. How long did it take him to reach the store?

Jenny went to the supermarket to buy bananas. The price of one banana was $0.80, and a bunch of bananas cost $3.00. She bought 10 bunches of bananas, and each bunch had an average of 4 bananas. How much money did she save by buying the bananas in bunches instead of buying them individually? Please express your answer in dollars.
Sam and Harry have 100 feet of fence between them. They decide to divide it such that Harry gets 60 feet more than Sam. What is the amount of fence left for Sam after the division?
If a crocodile grows 8 inches in length over a period of 4 years, what will be its expected length in inches after 13 years?

Marcel owns a bicycle store and sells three types of bikes: MTB, BMX, and Trekking. The price of an MTB is $500, a BMX costs half the price of an MTB, and a Trekking bike is priced at $450. In a month, Marcel sold a total of 300 bikes from these three types. Out of these, half were Trekking bikes, 15% were BMX bikes, and the remaining were MTB bikes. What is the total amount of money Marcel earned from selling bicycles during that month?

In a field, a farmer is baling hay at a rate of 5 bales per hour. Simultaneously, a truck is picking up the hay bales at a rate of 3 bales per hour. If both the farmer and the truck driver work for 6 hours, what is the total number of bales of hay left in the field?

A normal student has 6 periods in a day, but John has to attend 2 extra classes that are 40 minutes long each. He attends classes for 5 days a week and spends 1/16 of his weekly minutes on Saturday and Sunday for extra learning. What is the total number of hours John spends learning in a week?

Nathan owns a bouncy ball that rebounds to 2/3 of its original height with every bounce. He drops the ball from the third-floor balcony of a mall, where each story is 24 feet tall. What is the height that the ball reaches on its second bounce?

Caroline has four children and their heights are as follows: the first child is 6 feet tall, the second child is 2 inches taller than the first child, the third child is 5 inches shorter than the second child, and the fourth child is 3 inches taller than the third child. What is the height of the fourth child in inches?
If an apple orchard sells apples in bags of 10 and sold a total of 2000 apples in one day, how much money did the orchard earn by selling these apples at a price of $5 per bag?

What was the initial weight of the small triceratops that was hunted by a Tyrannosaurus rex, given that the T-Rex ate half of it, a pack of velociraptors scavenged half of what was left, and a group of lazy Allosaurus consumed the remaining 270 kilograms of meat?

Tony is painting a room that has four walls. The north and south walls are 10 feet in width and 8 feet in height. The east and west walls are 5 feet in width and 8 feet in height. The cost of one gallon of paint is $12 and it can cover an area of 20 square feet. What will be the total cost of painting the entire room?

Ellen played a prank on her friend by shaking 3 sodas out of a case of 12. She kept 1 unshaken soda for herself and left. Later, her brother took 1 shaken soda and 2 unshaken sodas. Now, Ellen's friend is about to take a soda. What is the probability, in percentage, that Ellen's friend will choose a shaken soda and get sprayed with it?
Assuming two trains leave a station in opposite directions, one traveling at a speed of 60 miles per hour and the other traveling at half that speed, what is the distance between them after 3 hours?

Billy is volunteering to assist people with their taxes. He can help 2 people every hour and works for 3 hours every day. He plans to take 20% of the days off between March 1st and April 19th. He will help people on all the other days. How many people will he help? Please note that March has 31 days.

Last weekend, Mary and John got married. Outside the church, there were 20 private cars and 12 buses parked. Each car had 3 people inside and each bus had 35 people inside. What is the total number of people who were inside the church during the ceremony?

If Mike is 24 years old and Martha is 4 years younger than him, then Martha is 20 years old. Jeff is 10 years older than Martha, so Jeff is 30 years old. Therefore, Jeff is 30 years old if his younger sister Martha is 20 years old and her boyfriend Mike is 24 years old.

At Five Flags, there are two waterslides. The biggest one is 300 feet long, and people slide down at a speed of 60 feet per minute. The second biggest slide is 240 feet long, but steeper, so people slide down at a speed of 80 feet per minute. What is the difference in time it takes to ride the biggest slide compared to the second biggest slide?
If Bobby takes a 30-minute lunch and two 15-minute breaks every day at the office, how many hours will he have spent on his lunches and breaks after 5 days?
Amber, Micah, and Ahito ran a total of 52 miles altogether. Amber ran 8 miles, and Micah ran 3.5 times more than what Amber ran. What is the distance that Ahito ran?

What is the new balance on Sheila's credit card after she charged $85.00 worth of merchandise, returned an item that cost $15.00, and then bought a frying pan that was on sale for 20% off $20.00 and a set of towels that was 10% off $30.00, both of which were charged to her credit card?

In a tank filled with jellyfish, one-fifth of them are large and some of the large jellyfish change color from green to blue under UV light. The rest of the jellyfish are small and always remain blue. When a UV light was turned on, 6 jellyfish changed color. What is the total number of jellyfish in the tank?

If Chris is 4 years old, and Ben is twice as old as Chris, then Ben's age is 2 x 4 = 8 years old. Caroline is three times older than Ben, so her age is 3 x 8 = 24 years old. Therefore, Caroline is 24 years old if Chris is 4 years old.

If Lauren is currently saving 20% of every paycheck and her current salary is $100,000, how many more years does she need to work in order to save enough for a retirement period of 20 years, during which she plans to live on 40% of her current annual salary?

Marty has a ribbon that is 100 centimeters long. He needs to divide it into 4 equal parts, and each of these parts must be divided into 5 equal parts. What will be the length of each of the final cuts?
What is the total number of students in the school if there are 240 boys and they make up 40% of the school population? Additionally, how many girls are in the school?
How much did my mom spend at the gardening shop if she bought a set of pots for $19, a sack of garden soil for $26, and used a $7 coupon at checkout?

At a cocktail party, there are six women in total. Three of them are wearing heels that are 4 inches tall, while the other three are wearing heels that are 2 inches tall. What is the average height of the heels worn by all the women at the party?

Soledad works indoors but enjoys being outside. She plans to hike 9,300 miles during her month-long vacation in June. She intends to walk twice a day, covering 125 miles each time. What is the additional number of miles per day that Soledad needs to hike to finish her journey on schedule?

If the store sells all of its 3 red balls, 11 blue balls, and 25 green balls, and the prices of red, blue, and green balls are $9, $5, and $3 respectively, what will be the total amount of money the store will receive?

Pierre, Paul, and Jacques purchased a total of 12 kg of apples. Peter wants 1/4th of the total amount, and Paul wants 1/3rd of the total amount. What is the weight of the apples that James will have left?

What was the temperature in degrees Celsius in the morning if the initial temperature was 2 degrees Celsius, it dropped by 8 degrees Celsius overnight, and then increased by 3 degrees Celsius in the morning?
If Raymond had $21 and saved $11 from his allowance, but spent $5 on a comic book and $19 on a puzzle, how much money does he have left?

Anna has a budget of $16 to buy books for her local library. She has already spent $4 and bought 2 books today, both of which cost the same amount. If Anna has $2 left in her budget, what is the cost of each book?
In the calligraphy class last year, there were 50 students. This year, the enrollment has increased by 20%. What is the total number of students enrolled in the calligraphy class this year?
If the light on a lighthouse blinks 255 times in 5 minutes, how many minutes will it take for the light to blink 459 times?

Tate has a garden pond with 4 male guppies, 7 female guppies, 3 male goldfishes, and 5 female goldfishes. He recently purchased 2 male guppies, 1 female guppy, 2 male goldfishes, and 3 female goldfishes. Determine the difference between the number of female fishes and male fishes in Tate's garden pond.

Amalia, Megan, and Dior shared household chores. Amalia spent 4 hours mowing the lawn, while Megan spent 2 hours more than Amalia walking the dog. Dior took more than 4 hours longer than Amalia to do the laundry. What is the total time they spent doing their chores together?

If John visits his parents twice a month and it takes him 2 hours to drive there at a speed of 70 mph, how many miles does he drive in a month when visiting his parents, taking into account the round trip?
If Sofie plans to walk 10 miles every day for 7 days, she will walk twice as far as Brian. How many miles will Brian walk in 7 days?

The toy manufacturer has an order for 400 toys and 5 workers are available to work on it. Two workers can produce 6 toys per hour and the other two can produce 4 toys per hour. All workers work for 10 hours but by the end of their shift, the manufacturer still needs 20 more toys to complete the order. What is the hourly production rate of the fifth worker?

Elijah has two dogs. The weight of one of Elijah's dogs is one-fourth the weight of Kory's dog, and the weight of the other dog is half the weight of Kory's dog. Kory's dog weighs 60 pounds. What is the total weight, in pounds, of both Elijah's dogs and Kory's dog combined?

If Seth gave half of his stickers to Luis, and Luis used half of the stickers and gave the rest to Kris, and Kris kept 9 of the stickers and gave the remaining 7 stickers to Rob, then how many stickers did Seth have in the beginning?

John wants to pack M&M in small bags, with 10 M&M in each bag. He has bought 3 large bags of M&M, each weighing 10 ounces. Each ounce of M&M contains 30 M&M. How many small bags can John make from the M&M he has bought?

Alfie, an albatross, covers a distance of 400 kilometers daily. The circumference of the earth is 40,000 kilometers. How many days will it take for Alfie to fly a distance equivalent to half the circumference of the earth?

Rani is very interested in sports cars and wants to know the speed of the fastest car ever made. She discovers that the fastest car was 1.25 times faster than the second fastest car, which was 5 times faster than the average car that can go 120 miles per hour. What is the speed of the fastest car?
Currently, Liam is 16 years old. Two years ago, Liam's age was twice the age of Vince. What is Vince's current age?

Arnold, Madeline, Camden, and Sarah painted a total of 56 Easter eggs. Arnold and Madeline painted an equal number of eggs. Camden and Sarah painted 30 eggs in total, but Camden painted 12 more eggs than Sarah. What is the difference between the number of eggs painted by Camden and Arnold?

Nik has 200 crayons that he wants to divide into groups of 8 and put into boxes. Each box weighs 8 ounces and each crayon weighs 1 ounce. If he puts all the crayons into boxes, what will be the total weight, in pounds, of the boxes and crayons? Assume that there are 16 ounces in a pound.

If John cuts down an 80-foot tree and can make logs out of 80% of it, and then cuts the logs into 4-foot pieces and further cuts each piece into 5 planks, selling each plank for $1.2, what is the total amount of money he makes?

Valerie's monthly salary is $5000, which is half of what her brother earns. The combined salary of Valerie and her brother is then multiplied by 2 to get their mother's salary. What is the total amount of money that the three of them have together?

Grandma walks 3 miles every day on her favorite walking trail. Her walking trail includes 2 miles of walking on the beach and 1 mile of walking on the sidewalk. She walks at twice the rate of speed on the sidewalk compared to the beach. She spends 40 minutes of her walk on the beach. What is the total time, in minutes, that it takes for Grandma to complete her entire 3-mile walk?

If Jane has saved $4 of her allowance every week for the past 8 weeks and she wants to save a total of $60, how many more weeks will it take for her to reach her goal if she continues to save the same amount each week?
In total, how many blue birds were there in 6 trees, where 3 trees had 7 blue birds each, 2 trees had 4 blue birds each, and 1 tree had 3 blue birds?

Bob currently has a certain number of marbles. If he receives 2 dozen more marbles, his total number of marbles will be 60. If he loses 10 of his current marbles, what will be his total number of marbles?

Donny has two mugs of water. He can only drink water that is at least 40 degrees. One of the mugs has a temperature of 33 degrees. Donny pours 4 ounces of water from the 33-degree mug into his water bottle and 1 ounce from the other mug. After doing so, he is able to drink the water. What is the minimum temperature of the second mug?

Melanie's father starts an animal farm with 50 cows and 20 chickens. For three weeks, Milkie Cows Limited delivers 20 cows per day and Broilers Limited delivers 10 chickens per day. What is the total number of cows and chickens on the farm after three weeks?

Russell has ordered his preferred bagels online. He has ordered 4 packs of bagels, and each pack costs $10.00 and contains 9 bagels. He will receive a 10% discount on his order. What is the cost of each individual bagel after he has ordered 4 packs?
Gomer ate mashed potatoes and had 5 less than 23 scoops. To make 1 less than 3 scoops of mashed potatoes, it takes 3 less than 6 potatoes. How many potatoes did Gomer eat?

Chester plans to consume 3 eggs per day for the first 30 days and then increase his intake to 5 eggs per day for the next 30 days. How many dozens of eggs will Chester require to fulfill his dietary needs for a total of 60 days?

In a jar of 60 jellybeans, Jess is trying to determine the number of blue jellybeans. She knows that there are 17 green jellybeans and twice as many red jellybeans as green ones. The remaining jellybeans are blue. What is the number of blue jellybeans in the jar?
If Tim grows 5 trees and collects 6 lemons from each tree every year, how many lemons will he have collected in 10 years?
On a bus, there are 5 men for every 9 women. The total number of passengers on the bus is 84. At the next stop, 20 women get off the bus. What is the number of women who are still on the bus?

Faraday is the owner of a flower shop where he sells sunflowers. He offers two options to his customers: a single sunflower for $2 or a bouquet of 12 sunflowers for $8. Faraday earned $26 per day from selling single sunflowers and $56 per day from selling bouquets. After 3 days, how many sunflowers did Faraday sell in total?

Adam has $100 and he wants to use it to start a rock stand. He can purchase rocks for $5 each and sell them for $7 each. If he invests all his money in the rock stand but only sells 60% of his inventory, what is the amount of money he loses?

Lauren is a cartoonist who has been hired for a project. The project requires her to create 45 large-sized picture scenes, 36 medium-sized picture scenes, and 49 small-sized picture scenes. She can draw 5 large-sized picture scenes per day, 6 medium-sized picture scenes per day, or 7 small-sized picture scenes per day. How many days will it take for her to complete the entire project?
Chatty has four children and she prepared three dozen eggs for their Easter activity. All the children will receive an equal number of eggs. What is the number of eggs that each child will receive?
Jen has 3 fish and each fish requires $1 worth of food per day. What is the total amount Jen spends on fish food for the month of May?
If Patricia had 30 roses and gave 24 of them to her mother, and then bought 15 more roses, how many roses does she have now?
What is the average speed at which Sid was traveling if he covered a distance of 110 miles in 2 hours and then traveled an additional 140 miles in 3 hours?

Mark purchases two lottery tickets. The first ticket has a 20% chance of winning, while the second ticket has three times more chances of winning than the first. What is the percentage probability that both tickets will be winners?

At the beach, Carlos, Jim, and Carrey were playing and decided to collect seashells. Jim collected 27 seashells, which was 5 more than what Carlos collected. Carlos collected twice as many seashells as Carrey. After collecting all the seashells, they divided them equally among themselves. What is the number of seashells each person got?
How many carrots does Mason eat in a week if he eats 4 carrots each day from Monday to Friday and 5 carrots each on Saturday and Sunday, given that he likes eating carrots?
What is the total duration of the cassette that John purchased, which contains two songs? The first song is 5 minutes long, and the second song is 60% longer than the first song.

Linus is employed in a trading company. He purchased a mobile device for $20 and sold it for twice the original price. On Monday, he bought 2 mobile devices, and on Tuesday, he bought 4. What is the total profit he earned after selling all the mobile devices he purchased on both days?

If Isabel is 7 feet tall, then her cousin Ned is 2 feet shorter, which means Ned is 5 feet tall. Carl is one foot taller than Ned, so Carl is 6 feet tall. Carl's cane is half as long as he is tall, so his cane is 3 feet long. Therefore, Carl's cane is 3 feet long.

Hortex company makes bottled carrot juices that can cover 20% of 1 person's daily energy demand. They produce 4200 bottles of these juices every day. To meet the daily energy needs of 2300 people, how many more bottles of juice does Hortex need to produce?

Carla has eight identical babies. She dresses six of them in purple and two of them in blue. Out of the babies wearing purple, one-third of them wear bows. What is the percentage probability that a baby wearing a bow is wearing purple?
How many tax reports did the IRS receive on Wednesday if they received a total of 5168 reports last week, 1907 reports on Monday and Tuesday, and 2136 reports on Thursday and Friday?

Abraham has 80 square meters of land that he is not using. He sold 1/2 of the land for $50 and then sold another 1/4 of the land for $30 after a month. He plans to sell the remaining land for $3 per square meter. What is the total amount of money that Abraham will earn after selling all of his unused land?
If Haley's age is 26 years, and Geb's age is 10 less than half of Haley's age, what is Geb's age?
If Tyrion changes his face mask twice every time he goes out and goes out three times a day, how many face masks does he use in a span of two days?

In an Easter egg hunt, Cole hid 36 eggs in the yard. Lamar found 5 eggs, while Stacy found twice as many as Lamar. Charlie found 2 less than Stacy, and Mei found half as many as Charlie. What is the total number of eggs that are still hidden in the yard?

John works as a garbage collector for three apartment complexes. The first two complexes have 200 apartments each. The third complex is 60% larger than the combined size of the first two complexes. John collects garbage from each complex three times a week. He earns $.40 for each collection from each apartment. What is John's weekly income?

How many fruits can an avocado tree produce during its 10-year lifespan, given that a 5-year-old tree produces 50 fruits, a 6-year-old tree produces 150 fruits, a 7-year-old tree produces 350 fruits, an 8-year-old tree produces 200 fruits less than a 10-year-old tree, a 9-year-old tree produces no fruits, and a 10-year-old tree produces 1000 fruits?
If Jack had $100 and Sophia gave him 1/5 of her $100, how much money does Jack have in total now?

If the combined length of three ropes is 37 centimeters and the blue rope is 7 centimeters shorter than the yellow rope, then the red rope is four times longer than the blue rope. What is the length of the red rope in centimeters?

If Ronnie was given $5 and Rissa was given three times as much, and they both gave an equal amount of money to their little sister, then Rissa is left with 4/5 of her money. How much money does Ronnie have left?

In a wall mural, there are four colors of paint used - red, white, purple, and yellow. The amounts of red, white, and purple paint used are equal. The yellow paint covers half of the mural. The total amount of paint used in the mural is 12 pints. What is the amount of red paint used in the mural?

Tom's house has 4 bedrooms, each measuring 20 by 12 feet. The living room is 5 times bigger than one bedroom. The remaining part of the house measures 1000 square feet. What is the total area, in square feet, of Tom's house?

Alice counts the puffs of clouds in the sky while having lunch outside at school. On Monday, she counts 3 puffs of clouds. From Tuesday to Friday, the number of clouds she sees in the sky doubles each day compared to the previous day. What is the total number of clouds she will have counted in the sky during lunch across all five days?

If a regular box of 100 dishwasher pods costs $12 and there's a special size box available for the same price that has 20% more pods, how many dishwashing cycles can you run for $1 using the new box if you use 1 pod per cycle?

Thomas withdrew $1000 from his bank account in the form of 20 dollar bills. On his way home, he loses 10 of these bills. After that, he uses half of the remaining bills to pay for a bill. He then triples his money and converts all his bills to 5 dollar bills. How many 5 dollar bills does he have in total?

In the soccer match, team A scored 4 goals in the first half while team B scored 2 goals fewer than team A. In the second half, team B scored 4 times the number of goals it scored in the first half, while team A scored 1/4 of the number of goals scored by team B. What is the total number of goals scored in the match?

A teacher writes math equations on a chalkboard using a 5-inch piece of chalk. He conserves chalk by using only 20% of it each day. However, he recycles the chalk when it is smaller than 2 inches because he cannot write with it. On Monday, the teacher used a new piece of chalk and used up 45% of it due to extra work. If the teacher goes back to using only 20% of the chalk each day, how many days does he have before he has to recycle this piece?

In Miss Albert's class, there are 12 boys and 12 girls. Out of the girls, one-third are on varsity, and out of the boys, one-fourth are on varsity. What is the total number of students who are not on varsity?
If Mike purchased 5 face masks, and Johnny bought 2 more than three times the number of face masks Mike bought, then how many face masks did Johnny purchase?
James has a total of 30 teeth. The dentist drills 4 of his teeth and caps 7 more teeth than he drills. What percentage of James' teeth does the dentist fix?

A company sold 4000 gallons of milk to Mr. Marcellus' store at a cost of $3.5 per gallon. Later, Mr. Marcellus discovered that 2/5 of the milk he purchased had expired and could not be sold. He returned the sour milk to the company and requested a refund. What is the amount of refund Mr. Marcellus received?
What is Colin's current age if Wendy's age is five times the age Colin will be in seven years, and in 25 years, Colin's age will be one-third of Wendy's current age?
Bob has $27000 to buy books for 3 schools. He can buy 100 books for $500. What is the number of books he can buy for each school?

After two apples fell out of the tree, one of them landed on Newton's head. Newton then picked up both apples, kept one in his pocket, and threw the other apple back into the tree. This caused 5 more apples to fall out of the tree. Newton picked up all of these apples, kept one and threw the remaining apples back into the tree. This caused 6 more apples to fall out of the tree. Newton picked up all of the remaining apples and went home to make a pie. How many apples did he bring home in total?

During the winter season, Ali placed an order for 850 kilos of coal to use for heating purposes. The coal is delivered in bags of 50 kg each, and each bag costs $18. What is the total cost of Ali's order?

If Kate wants to serve 6 of her friends, and each of them wants to eat 6 slices of cheese pizza and 4 slices of pepperoni pizza, how many cheese and pepperoni pizzas does she need to buy if the cheese pizza is cut into 12 slices and the pepperoni pizza is cut into 8 slices?
What is the total distance covered by Sam in a week if he ran 3 miles on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, and 5 miles on Tuesday and Thursday?

Jay is getting ready for a snowball fight with his sister and needs 60 snowballs. He can make 20 snowballs in an hour, but 2 snowballs melt every 15 minutes. How much time will it take for Jay to make 60 snowballs?
Digimon recently celebrated its 20th anniversary. At the time of its release, John's age was twice that of Jim's. Given that John is currently 28 years old, what is Jim's current age?

Doxa cut an apple into 8 pieces. Out of these, she ate 1 slice. Her sister ate 1 more slice than Doxa, and her brother ate 1 more slice than her sister. How many slices of apple did the three of them eat in total?

At the nurses' station, bandages are ordered in bulk packs of 50. On the first day, the nurses used 38 bandages and ordered one bulk pack of bandages. On the second day, they used 28 bandages. On the third day, they ordered two bulk packs of bandages and used only 25 bandages. At the end of the third day, they had 78 bandages left. What was the initial number of bandages they had on the first day?

May is planning to have her hair cut and colored. The cost of coloring her hair is $40, and the cost of cutting her hair is $30 per inch. Initially, her hair was 10 inches long, but after the cut, it became 8 inches long. What is the total cost of May's hair cut and color?

Jen works for 6 days a week and 7.5 hours a day. She earns $1.5 per hour and gets an extra $10 if she has perfect attendance. In April, she did not miss any day of work. If April has 4 weeks, how much will Jen earn for that month?

Jason was given the opportunity to earn money by doing certain tasks. He could earn $3.00 for doing his laundry, $1.50 for cleaning his room, $0.75 for taking the trash to the curb each week and $0.50 for emptying the dishwasher. Over a period of two weeks, Jason completed the following tasks: he emptied the dishwasher 6 times, did his laundry once, took the trash out twice and cleaned his room once. How much money did Jason earn in total?

Brady learned in her science class that a whale in the sea has 40 gallons of blood. She also learned that a shark has three times as much blood as a whale. How many gallons of blood do ten sharks swimming in the sea have?

Mr. Maxim is an employee at The Best Cookeries Around restaurant. In the morning, 50 people came to the restaurant to eat. At 10:00, 40 more people came and ordered the same amount of food as the first group. Later, twice the number of people who came at 10:00 came in for lunch. Finally, by evening, the number of people who came in was three times the number of people who came in the morning. What is the total number of people who entered the restaurant on that day?
Alain's mom purchased 5 packs of red pens and twice the amount of black pens as the red pens. Each pack contains 5 pens. How many pens does Alain have in total?

John purchases 10 bottles of scotch, and the total cost of the scotch is $600. Additionally, he buys twice the number of bottles of cognac, and each bottle of cognac costs 50% more than each bottle of scotch. What is the total amount John spends on his purchases?

How many trees did Mr. Julius plant in total during the two-day local community tree-planting campaign? On the first day, he planted 20 White Oak trees and twice as many Lodgepole Pine trees as White Oak trees. On the second day, he planted 10 more White Oak trees than on the first day, and 1/4 more Lodgepole Pine trees than he planted on the first day.

Fred made 24 gallons of root beer for a party that was to be held in four days. On the first day, he put the root beer in the refrigerator cooler, but his children drank 4 gallons of it. On the second day, his wife accidentally spilled 7 gallons of the root beer. On the third day, Fred's friend Ronnie drank 5 gallons of the root beer. On the fourth day, there were 3 people at the party. If they shared the remaining root beer equally, how much root beer was available for each person to drink during the party?
If the number of coffee mugs in the teacher's lounge is multiplied by four and then eight is added to the result, the total is 40. What is the number of coffee mugs in the teacher's lounge?

In a fish tank, there are a total of 66 fish. Out of these, one-third of the fish have red stripes. After that, 5/11 of the remaining fish have blue stripes. What is the total number of fish that have both red and blue stripes?

Amy initially had two eyeshadow palettes, each containing four colors, and three makeup sets, each containing six eyeshadow colors. One of the palettes was stolen by her sister. Amy used half of the colors from one of the makeup sets. The question is asking for the total number of eyeshadow colors that Amy has left.

Mattison's height is 60 inches. His two-story house is 7 times higher than his height. The height from the floor to the ceiling on the first floor is three times his height. What is the height of the roof from the second floor's floor in inches?

In a strip mall parking lot, twenty tourists found 700 shells. They split into three groups, Alphas, The finders, and Gogetters, to collect as many shells as possible. Team Alphas found 40% of the shells, and team The finders found 60% of the remaining shells. The question is, how many shells did team Gogetters find?

Bernie has a total of 4 dogs and each dog requires a specific amount of exercise per day. The first dog needs to walk 1 mile, the second dog needs to walk 4 miles, and the third dog needs to walk 3 miles. On average, all the dogs need to walk a total of 3 miles per day. What is the distance that the fourth dog needs to walk?
If John mortgages his home worth $250,000 to get a loan worth 40% of its value, and then uses 60% of that loan to pay off his debts, how much money does he have left after paying off his debts?

Last Monday, Deandre caught three tunas. The weight of the first tuna he caught is 56 kilograms, the second tuna weighs 46 kilograms, and the last tuna weighs 26 kilograms. If the price of one kilogram of tuna is $0.50, what is the total amount of money he will earn after selling all the tunas in the market?
Trinity bought some magazines for $72 and sells them at 11/8 of the price she bought them. What is the profit that Trinity made?

Brian purchased a dehumidifier to remove moisture from the damp and musty air in his basement. The device has three speeds: low, medium, and high. Brian conducted an experiment to test the efficiency of the device. He found that the low setting removes 1 liter of water from the air per day, the medium setting removes twice as much water per day as the low setting, and the high setting removes twice as much water per day as the medium setting. Brian ran the dehumidifier for 3 days on the low setting, followed by 3 days on the medium setting, and then 5 days on the high setting. What is the total amount of water, in liters, that the dehumidifier removed from the air in Brian's basement?

Jolene and her friends are starting their summer with a water balloon fight. They have 10 packs of balloons, and each pack contains 30 balloons. At the end of the afternoon, they have 12 balloons left. How many balloons did they throw during the water balloon fight?
Saanvi needs to mix 14 mL of one medicine with 3 times that amount of another medicine for one dosage. How much medicine in mL would be required for 8 doses?

Ali is a dean at a private school and teaches one class. The capacity of his class is 120 students. John is a dean at a public school and teaches two classes. Each of John's classes has a capacity of 1/8 of Ali's class. What is the total capacity of both schools?

Stephen borrowed $300 from his sister and agreed to pay back the money with an extra 2% interest. He will pay his sister $25 each month for 11 months, and the remaining amount, along with the interest, will be paid in the twelfth month. What is the total amount that Stephen will pay in the twelfth month?

Jordan has 2 children who wear diapers and each child needs 5 diaper changes per day. Jordan's wife changes half of the diapers. The question is asking for the number of diapers that Jordan changes per day.

In a competition, Tim is required to guess the number of red jelly beans present in a jar. The jar has a square base with dimensions of 6 inches by 6 inches and is 15 inches tall. Tim is aware that the volume of a single jelly bean is 0.15 cubic inches and that the packing efficiency is approximately 80%. He estimates that 30% of the jelly beans in the jar are red. The actual number of red jelly beans in the jar is 900. What is the difference between Tim's guess and the actual number of red jelly beans?

What is the total number of people that can fit on a bus that has a capacity of 200 people? When the bus left Chengli city, how many people were on it? At the first stop, how many people got on the bus? At the second stop, how many people got on the bus, if 3/4 of the number of people who got on at the first stop also got on at the second stop? If the number of passengers on the bus doubled at the third stop, how many more people are needed to fill the remaining spaces on the bus?

How much did Pauline spend on visiting her favorite local museum over a period of 8 years, if she used to visit the museum three times a year and the cost of one visit was $2 initially? The cost of one visit increased by 150% after 5 years, but Pauline continued to visit the museum for 3 more years without giving up any visit.

At Cedar Falls Middle School, students in grades 4-7 are encouraged to earn as many Accelerated Reader points as possible. The top 10 students in each grade get to participate in an escape room activity organized by the teachers. However, only 8 students can participate at a time, and they have 45 minutes to complete the challenge. If all the groups use the full 45 minutes, how much time will it take for all the eligible students to participate in the escape room activity?

John, who is a carpenter, made 4 wooden tables for his friend Ali at a cost of $20 each and also manufactured 2 roof frames for $10 each. What is the total amount that Ali needs to pay John for these items?
Ian has a board that is 40 feet long and he wants to cut it into two pieces. One of the pieces is 4 times longer than the other piece. What is the length of the longer piece?

Aiden is preparing for a neighborhood cookout and plans to make his famous steakhouse-seasoned meatballs. He uses two tablespoons of his secret steakhouse seasoning for every pound of ground beef and can make sixteen meatballs from each pound of meat. He wants to make 80 meatballs for the cookout. How many tablespoons of his secret seasoning will he need to make this amount of meatballs?

Luke wants to purchase fabric for new curtains for his five windows. Each window has a width of 35 inches. He needs to buy fabric that is equal to twice the total width of all the windows. What is the total amount of fabric that Luke needs to buy?

If you make a call from a payphone, you will be charged $0.25 for each minute of the call. However, if your call lasts for more than 16 minutes, the price per minute drops to $0.2. What would be the cost of a 36-minute call?
On Monday, there was a rainfall of 2 inches. On Tuesday, the expected rainfall will be 1 inch more than twice the amount of rainfall on Monday. What will be the total amount of rainfall on Tuesday?

Carly is preparing treats for her art class consisting of cupcakes and brownies. She makes a total of brownies that is two less than three times the number of cupcakes. The class has five people and each person will receive two treats. How many cupcakes did Carly make?

If Karen chooses to get a basic manicure and pedicure at a certain salon, she will have to pay $35 and $40 respectively. However, the salon offers a discount of 20% if both services are availed together. Additionally, Karen wants to add nail art on each of her fingers, which costs $3 per nail. What would be the total cost for Karen if she chooses to get both services and add nail art on each of her fingers?

Susan subscribes to 3 magazines, each of which sends 12 issues per year. Additionally, she subscribes to 1 magazine that sends 6 issues per year. One of her magazines sends her 4 times the number of issues that the 6-issue magazine sends. What is the total number of magazines that Susan receives in a year?

If Samantha has 27 paintings and she has 12 fewer paintings than Shelley, then Shelley has 27 + 12 = 39 paintings. Also, Shelley has 8 more paintings than Kim. Therefore, Kim has 39 - 8 = 31 paintings. How many paintings does Kim have if Samantha has 27 paintings, Shelley has 39 paintings, and Shelley has 8 more paintings than Kim?

In November, the price of a toy was $40. In December, the price increased by 80% of its original price. In January, the price decreased by 50% of the price it was in December. What was the final price of the toy after the discount in January?

Charlie is a professional tennis player who teaches others how to improve their game. He charges $80 per hour for his lessons, but he offers a 25% discount to veterans. Today, he has four 1-hour lessons at his regular rate and two 1-hour lessons with a veteran. What is the total amount of money he will earn for the day in dollars?
What is the average score of Sally's math quizzes if she received the following scores: 50, 80, 80, 60, 40, 90, 100, 70, and 60?
If Eve had 20 pomelos and gave some to her friend, she was left with only 1/4 of the original amount. How many pomelos did Eve give away to her friend?

How many dollars did Walter receive after selling the apples he bought from the store? Walter bought 60 apples, ate 2/5 of them, and gave his sister 25% of the remaining apples. He sold the remaining apples to his uncle at $3 each.

Last year, Regina wrote 9 novels. It is known that this number is equal to 3/4 of the total number of novels she has written this year. What is the total number of novels Regina has written this year?

If Michael travels on the interstate for 3 days, taking into account all necessary stops, at an average speed of 50km/hr, what percentage of the 6000 km distance between Alaska and Texas will he have covered?

If Madeline ate 6 grapes and her brother used 5 times as many grapes as Madeline to make a full glass of grape juice, and their mother used the remaining grapes to make 4 pies, and the recipe calls for 12 grapes per pie, then how many grapes were there at the beginning?

On a particular Friday, Rydell Elementary School had a total of 82 teachers. Out of these, 13 teachers were absent due to sickness and 9 substitute teachers were called in to fill in for them. What is the total number of teachers who were present at the school on that day?

If Bud makes homemade macaroni and cheese once a week, and the pasta costs $1.00 per box, and he spends $3.00 on cheddar cheese and twice that amount on gruyere cheese, then how much money does he spend on making macaroni and cheese in one year?
What percentage of an 8-hour workday does a custodian spend cleaning classrooms if they have to clean 80 classrooms in 5 days, and it takes them 15 minutes to clean each classroom?

Elly has 4 shelves on her new bookcases. The middle 2 shelves can hold 10 books each. The bottom shelf can hold twice as many books as a middle shelf. The top shelf can hold 5 fewer books than the bottom shelf. Elly has 110 books. How many bookcases does she need to hold all of them?
If Rose purchased 60 eggs for $2.40 per dozen, and plans to sell them for $1 for every 3 eggs, what will be her profit?

Skyler has a total of 100 hats in his hand. The hats come in three colors: red, blue, and white. Half of the hats are red. After the red hats are removed, there are some hats left. 3/5 of these remaining hats are blue. The rest of the hats that are not red or blue are white. The question is asking for the number of white hats that Skyler has.
Archie purchases a bag of beef jerky that contains 30 sticks and costs $18.00. He avails a discount of $3.00 on the purchase of one bag. Determine the cost of each stick of jerky in cents.

Audrey needs to pass two math tests to move on to the 7th grade. To pass, she must correctly answer 70% of all the questions. On the first test, which has 70 questions, she answered 60% of them correctly. Now, she needs to know how many questions she needs to answer correctly on the second test, which has 40 questions, to pass and move on to the 7th grade.

Mary is preparing for a cocktail party and wants to make ice cubes with fruit frozen in them. She decides to make some strawberry cubes and a certain number of blueberry cubes. The number of blueberry cubes is equal to 5 times the number of strawberry cubes minus 4. Mary makes a total of 116 ice cubes. How many blueberry cubes does she make?
How many points has Ara scored in the four years since she joined the school basketball team, given that she has played 40 games every year and scored 21 points in each game?

Brendan had a bag of 10 marbles but dropped half of them after tripping over a pebble. He found only 3 of the dropped marbles. Later, he discovered that one of the marbles he picked up was actually a bead and he discarded it. What is the total number of marbles that Brendan has now?

Jason is a salesperson at a car dealership and he wants to earn a big bonus this month by selling 15 cars. He has observed that for every 25 telephone calls he makes to potential customers, one person comes to the dealership to look at new cars. Additionally, for every two customers who come to the dealership, one buys a car. How many telephone calls does Jason need to make to sell 15 cars and earn his bonus, based on these average numbers?

When the power goes out in Brianna's house, she and her family gather all their candles and flashlights. Brianna's house has 8 rooms and 4 people live there. There is a flashlight for every person to carry and two for each room. They have a total of 4 small candles for half of the rooms and 5 medium candles for the other half of the rooms. How many candles and flashlights are being used by Brianna's family when the power goes out?

Mitchell is preparing nachos for his family, which consists of five members. He purchases two bags of chips, each containing 55 chips. If he wants to distribute the chips equally among all family members, how many chips will each person receive?

If John takes 5 minutes to solve the first side of the Rubik's cube, then he takes twice that time to solve the second and third sides. The last two sides take half as long as the first side. Once all six sides are solved, the Rubik's cube is complete. What is the total time taken to solve the Rubik's cube?

In the changing room of Dominick's team, there were robots, helmets, and footballs. When Dominick went there, he noticed that the number of robots was half the number of helmets, and the number of helmets was half the number of footballs. If there were 20 helmets in the changing room, how many items did Dominick see in total?
During a 5 day work week, Tim spends 6 hours each day answering phones at work. He takes 15 minutes to deal with a call. What is the total number of calls he deals with during the week?

Louise, an artist, wants to apply a coat of varnish to her latest paintings. She usually takes 7 minutes for the coat of varnish to dry on one painting. However, today she is using a new varnish that takes 12 minutes for the coat to dry. She wants to know how much longer it will take for the coat of varnish on 6 paintings to dry with the new varnish compared to the old varnish.

How much water in cups does Crista need to water her 20 plants every day, given that 4 of them require 0.5 cups of water, 8 require 1 cup of water, and the remaining plants require 0.25 cups of water each?

If Phineas Frog was washed away 200 yards from his home in the swamp due to a rainstorm that flooded the wetlands, he will need to hop and swim his way back. He can hop on land at a speed of 20 yards per minute and swim through water at a speed of 10 yards per minute. If half of the distance is on land and the other half is in water, how many minutes will it take Phineas to return home?

Bob wants to build the Washington Monument for his history project and thinks he needs 56 popsicle sticks. He prefers buying popsicles that come in boxes of 8 and cost $2.00 per box. What is the total cost of popsicles that Bob needs to buy for his project?
If there are five phones on a phone plan and the main phone costs twice as much as each additional phone, and the main phone plan costs $20, what is the total cost of the whole phone plan?
If Derrick sells all the 10 dozen doughnuts that his bakery makes every day in June, and each doughnut is sold at $2, how much money will he make in total?

Jade has a new cell phone with an amazing camera and she took 210 photos of her daily life in a week. She plans to upload all the photos on her Instagram account. She can upload 7 photos in one batch and she intends to upload 6 batches each day. How many days will it take for her to upload all the photos?

What is the total cost of dry-cleaning Alicia's clothes for 5 weeks if she sends 5 blouses, 2 pants, and 1 skirt to the dry cleaners every week, and the dry cleaners charge $5.00 per blouse, $6.00 per skirt, and $8.00 per pair of pants?

John has taken up a new hobby of speed talking. He normally speaks at a speed of 150 words per minute. After training, his speed has increased by 2.5 times. If each page has 450 words, how much time will John take to speak 10 pages?

Conor lives close to a beach and visits it daily for enjoyment. On the first day of a particular week, he counted 50 people at the beach. The following day, there were 20 more people than the previous day, and on the third day, the number of people doubled the second day's count. For the remaining days of the week, Conor saw an average of 60 people each day. Determine the total number of people Conor saw at the beach that week.

Garrett is making popcorn as a snack. Initially, 20 kernels pop in the first 30 seconds of cooking. In the next 30 seconds, three times the initial amount of kernels pop. After that, the popping rate increases to four times the initial rate in the following 30 seconds. However, in the final 30 seconds, the popping rate slows down to half the rate of the previous 30 seconds. Once Garrett takes the pan off the heat, a quarter of the number of kernels that popped in the last 30 seconds also pop due to residual heat. How many pieces of popcorn has Garrett made?

Tim is planning to make lemonade for a pool party. He needs 4 gallons of lemonade, and for each gallon, he requires 1 cup of fresh lemon juice. To obtain 1 cup of juice, he needs 6 lemons. Tim's friend Allen requested an extra gallon of lemonade that should be twice as tart as the other gallons. How many lemons will Tim need in total to make the lemonade for the party, including the extra gallon for Allen?

The Kennel house has 3 German Shepherds and 2 Bulldogs. Each German Shepherd eats 5 kilograms of dog food per day, while each Bulldog eats 3 kilograms of dog food per day. How many kilograms of dog food will they need for a week?
On a farm, there are two types of animals: 10 animals with 2 legs and 15 animals with 4 legs. Assuming all animals are healthy, what is the total number of pairs of legs on the farm?
In a tower, there are 4 blue blocks and twice as many yellow blocks as blue blocks. The total number of blocks in the tower is 32. What is the number of red blocks in the tower?

Elvis left his house and drove towards the west for 5 hours. After that, he turned around and drove towards the east for 8 hours. During the entire journey, he maintained an average speed of 18mph. What is the current distance between Elvis and his house?
Gary purchased a boat for $9000. The boat depreciated by 30% in the first year, another 30% in the second year, and 20% in the third year. What is the current value of the boat after three years?

In a bag of Starbursts candy, there are 232 individually wrapped candies. Out of these, there are 54 red candies, twice as many orange candies as red candies, and half as many yellow candies as red candies. The question is asking for the number of pink candies in the bag.

During her trip to Germany, Helen stayed at a hotel for three nights, which cost $80 per night. She also took the bus seven times, and each bus trip cost 10% of the price of one night at the hotel. What was the total cost of Helen's hotel stay and bus travels during her trip?
Mazie gave 52 marbles to twins, Dallas and Darla. After dropping 4 marbles in the playground, Dallas has 21 marbles. What is the number of marbles that Mazie gave to Darla?

A family consisting of parents and a child went to the cinema. They purchased an adult ticket for $12 and a child ticket for $8. Additionally, they bought two popcorns for $3 each. What is the total amount of money they spent?

If John's car, which weighs 1200 pounds and has luggage weighing 250 pounds and two young children weighing 75 pounds each, breaks down, and the force required to move the car is 1% of its weight, what is the amount of force John needs to push the car?

For his birthday party, James plans to decorate his backyard fence with crepe-paper streamers. The fence is rectangular and has a length of 20 feet on one side and a width of 15 feet on the other side. What is the total length of crepe paper that James needs to purchase for this decoration?
Mia and Emma have an age difference of 16 years. Mia is currently 40 years old and younger than Emma. What is the average age of Mia and Emma?

On the beach, Tom found 214 seashells, Nancy found 432 seashells, and Benny found 86 seashells. After cleaning the seashells, they found out that 67 of them were cracked. What is the total number of good seashells that they found together?

What is the total cost of 36 dinner plates, 36 salad plates, and 36 bowls if Avery is hosting a holiday dinner for 12 people and needs to purchase a 3 piece place setting (dinner & salad plate and a bowl)? The dinner plates cost $6.00 each, the salad plates cost $4.00 each, and the bowls cost $5.00 each.
Steve spent 10 hours to complete a puzzle. Anna took more than half of Steve's time plus 2 hours to complete the same puzzle. What is the total time Anna spent to finish the puzzle?

If Dexter has five pigs and each pig eats 4 pounds of feed twice a day, then in a week, they would consume a total of 280 pounds of feed. Dexter ordered 300 pounds of feed, so how many pounds of feed will be left after a week?

If John invited 20 people to his birthday party and each guest will eat 2 hot dogs, how many hot dogs does he need? He already has 4 hot dogs left over from a previous party. A pack of hot dogs contains 6 hot dogs and costs $2. How much money does John need to spend on hot dogs?

Frances sold 20 cupcakes at a price of $2 per cupcake and 40 cookies at a price of $1 each. She also bought five trays at a cost of $4 per tray. What is the amount of money that Frances has remaining?

In a neighborhood, an ice cream truck is being chased by children from different homes. At the end of the first street, there are 5 children following the truck. On the second street, each child is joined by one more child. On the third street, each child in the group is joined by two more children. After the first 5 children leave the group, how many children are still following the truck?

Mamou has volunteered to distribute 1,360 meals to families affected by recent floods in her country. She has already given out 64 meals on Friday, 30 meals on Saturday, and 48 meals on Sunday. How many meals does she have left to distribute to the affected families?
James checks the coin return of the vending machine for change and on a particular day, he finds a quarter, two nickels, and 7 dimes. What is the total value of the coins in cents that James found?

How many siblings are there in a family consisting of 2 brothers and 3 sisters? What is the age of the sisters and the two brothers? One of the brothers is 12 years old and the other is twice his age. What is the sum of the ages of all the siblings?

Charisma meditates twice a day, for 15 minutes each time, once in the morning and once before going to bed. Additionally, she practices yoga for 1 hour, 5 days a week. In a span of 4 weeks, what is the total time Charisma has spent on her meditation and yoga practice?

What is the total area of the quilt that Octavia is making for her sister using small, medium, and large t-shirts? Octavia has 11 small t-shirts, each with 3 square feet of fabric, 8 medium t-shirts, each with 4 square feet of fabric, and 6 large t-shirts, each with 6 square feet of fabric.
If a small sunflower has 36 seeds, how many seeds does a large sunflower have if it has 50% more seeds than the small sunflower? What is the total number of seeds in both sunflowers combined?

If George has 18 pens, Timothy has three times that amount, which is 54 pens. Sarah has half as many pens as Timothy, so she has 27 pens. How many pens does Sarah have if George has 18 pens and Timothy has 54 pens?

Before summer, Jackie's height was such that she grew 3" over the summer. Currently, Jackie is 2" shorter than Anne, who is twice as tall as Albert. Given that Albert's height is 36", what was Jackie's height before summer?
How much money will a company receive if it sells all the 5000 chocolate bars it produces in a day for $2 per bar, for two weeks?

If Jake buys 2 T-shirts at a store that has a buy one get one 50% off deal on T-shirts, and each T-shirt costs $8, and then he buys a pair of shoes that is 40% off the original price of $40, what is the total amount of money he spends at the store?

If Ryan completes his chores each week, he gets $6 as his allowance. He did his chores for 3 weeks and spent $5 on ice cream cones for himself and 3 friends. Now, he wants to buy movie tickets for himself and his friends, and each ticket costs $6.50. How many movie tickets can Ryan buy?

Ellen and her sister, Lani, visited the mall to purchase gifts for their mother. Ellen spent $100 on a pair of leggings and $5 on a photo frame. Lani purchased a pair of sunglasses for $30 and two bathrobes for $100 each. What was the total amount spent by them?

Tim produces a unique blend of honey and jam. The recipe for one jar of the mixture requires 2 pounds of passion fruit, 1.5 pounds of jackfruit, and 2 pounds of special honey. The cost of passion fruit is $6 per pound, jackfruit is $8 per pound, and honey is $10 per pound. Tim sells each jar for $50. What is the profit he earns by selling 10 jars?
Justin has a jar containing a variety of coins. The jar has 32 quarters, 95 dimes, 120 nickels, and 750 pennies. What is the total value of all the coins in the jar in dollars?

Janet went to the mall and spent $3.50 on ice cream, $7.50 each on movie tickets for herself and her younger sister, and $8.50 on a bracelet. Her parents gave her $40. How much money does she have left after all her expenses?
Josh owns a car shop where he services 3 cars every day, except on Sundays and Wednesdays. He charges $4 for each car he services. What is the total amount of money he earns in 2 weeks?

Randy had 9 oatmeal cookies, 4 chocolate chip cookies, and 5 sugar cookies. He ate 3 cookies, one of each flavor, for an early day snack. Later, for lunch, he ate 2 oatmeal cookies. He gave 2 sugar cookies to his friends. Then, he baked 4 of each flavor for dinner. What is the total number of cookies Randy has now?

Matthew has 12 toy soldiers that are all different from each other. He wants to sell them at a reasonable price. He found a buyer who is willing to pay $5 for each toy for half of his collection and $7 for each toy for the other half. If Matthew agrees to this offer, how much money will he earn?

If Nate's dog can dig six holes a day and he digs for 14 days while Nate is on vacation, how many holes does he dig in total? When Nate returns, he starts filling in 9 holes a day, but the dog continues to dig 6 new holes every night. How many weeks will it take for Nate to fill in all the holes?

Norman High School has an average enrollment of 4000 students per year. The neighboring school, Butler High School, enrolls an average of 3/4 of the number of students enrolled at Norman High School. What is the difference between the average enrollment at Norman High School and the average enrollment at Butler High School?

The Adams family has made a total of 7995 cookies. Out of these, they have made 2595 rainbow cookies and 3075 oatmeal cookies. The number of chocolate chip cookies they have made is unknown. Can you determine how many chocolate chip cookies the Adams family has made?

Dr. Hugo Grumpus and his assistant, Igor, were getting ready to conduct a laboratory experiment. Dr. Grumpus instructed Igor to collect 16 test tubes, 7 beakers, and 14 Petri dishes and place them on the lab bench. However, Igor mistakenly gathered half the number of test tubes required and two more Petri dishes than needed. Although he collected the correct number of beakers, he lost some while transporting them to the lab bench. In total, Igor placed 29 items on the lab bench. How many beakers did Igor lose?

If James is assembling 4 tables, and each table requires 4 legs, and each leg needs 2 screws, and he has 40 screws, then how many screws will he have remaining after completing the assembly of all 4 tables?
In one basket, there are 10 eggs. In another basket, there are twice as many eggs as the first basket. What is the total number of eggs in both baskets when they are combined?

The girls are collecting funds for a carnival. Alexandra raises $430, and Kim raises $320 more than Alexandra. Sarah raises $300, and Maryam raises $400 more than Sarah. What is the total amount of money, in dollars, that all the girls raised?

Aaron and Vanessa were on the same relay race team. Aaron ran each mile twice as fast as Vanessa did, but Vanessa was able to run twice as far as Aaron. Vanessa ran a total of 4 miles, and Aaron completed his part of the race in 16 minutes. How many minutes did it take Vanessa to complete her part of the race?

The caretaker of the docks wants to purchase new line for the docks. He needs 3 feet of line for every foot of dock. Currently, there are 200 feet of dock and he has 6 feet of new line. What is the total length of line he needs to buy?

If Tom's restaurant receives 6 reservations every night, and each reservation orders 2 meals that cost $5 each and a $5 bottle of wine, how much money does the restaurant make in a week if it is open for 2 days?
What was the selling price of each of the 50 watermelons that a fruit vendor bought for $80, if he sold all of them at a profit of 25%?

When John was 19 years old, he became a father to James. Currently, James is twice as old as his sister Dora, who will turn 12 years old in 3 years. John's youngest son was born when he was 32 years old. What will be the age of John's youngest son in 3 years?

In a basket, there are oranges that Ana and Jane will peel. Ana takes 3 minutes to peel one orange, while Jane takes 4 minutes. If they both start peeling oranges at the same time, how many more oranges will Ana have peeled than Jane after an hour?

Mark's car has a broken radiator and he needs to replace it. A new radiator costs $400, but he buys it from a junk shop at a discount of 80%. He also hires a mechanic to install it, and the installation takes 3 hours at a rate of $50 per hour. What is the total amount that Mark pays for the radiator and installation?
On Farmer Brown's farm, there are 20 animals which are either cows or chickens. The total number of legs of all the animals on the farm is 70. What is the number of chickens on the farm?

Henry and his three friends have ordered 7 pizzas for lunch. Each pizza has been divided into 8 slices. They want to divide the pizzas equally among themselves. What is the number of slices that each of them can have?
